BAYESIAN JOINT CHANCE CONSTRAINED OPTIMIZATION APPROXIMATIONS AND STATISTICAL CONSISTENCY PRATE EK IS WAL HARSHA HON APPA AND VINAYAK RAO Abstract This paper considers data driven chance constrained stochastic optimization problems in Bayesian framework Bayesian posteriors or principled mechanism to incorporate data and prior knowledge into stochastic optimization problems However the computation of Bayesian posteriors is typically an intractable problem and has spawned large literature on approximate Bayesian computation Here in the context of chance constrained optimization we focus on the question of statistical consistency in nap pro pri ate sense of the optimal value computed using an approximate posterior distribution To this end we rigorously prove frequent is consistency result demonstrating the convergence of the optimal value to the optimal value of axed parameterized constrained optimization problem We augment this by also establishing probabilistic rate of convergence of the optimal value We also prove the convex feasibility of the approximate Bayesian stochastic optimization problem Finally we demonstrate the utility of our approach on an optimal tang problem for an queueing model

Image to Image Translation of Synthetic Samples for Rare Classes Edoardo Lanz in araB eery Delft University of Technology California Institute of Technology Me kel weg CD Delft Netherlands California Blvd Pasadena CA lanz in student tu delft nl beer caltech edu Abstract day night The natural world is long tailed rare classes are ob served orders of magnitudes less frequently than common real ones leading to highly imbalanced data where rare classes can have only handfuls of examples Learning from few ex ample is known challenge for deep learning based class cation algorithms and is the focus of the el do flow shot learning One potential approach to increase the training data for these rare classes is to augment the limited real data with synthetic samples This has been shown to help syn but the domain shift between real and synthetic hinders the approaches efc cy when tested on real data We explore the use of image to image translation meth od to close the domain gap between synthetic and real Figure Examples of real and synthetic images of deer The imagery for animal species classic ation in data collected visual difference between the two domains is noticeable for both from camera traps motion activated static cameras used day and night examples to monitor wildlife We use low level feature alignment be tween source and target domains to make synthetic data for rare species generated using graphics engine more re like Image Net These include long tailed distributions ali stic Compared against system augmented with un and multitude of different sub domains locations aligned synthetic data our experiments show consider within the same data set In particular the classic ation able decrease in classic ation error rate sonar are species of rare species of animals is notoriously troublesome due to the combined effect of scarcity in number of examples and the low sample efc ien cy of data from given camera Xi

Improved convergence rates and trajectory convergence for primal dual dynamical systems with vanishing damping Radu Ioan Bot Dang Kho Nguyen June Abstract In this work we approach the minimization of continuously dieren ti able convex fun tion under linear equality constraints by second order dynamical system with as mp to ic ally vanishing damping term The system is formulated in terms of the augmented La gran gian associated to the minimization problem We show fast convergence of the primal dual gap the feasibility measure and the objective function value along the generated trajectories In case the objective function has Lipschitz continuous gradient we show that the primal dual trajectory asymptotically weakly converges to primal dual optimal so lu tion of the underlying minimization problem To the best of our knowledge this is the rst result which guarantees the convergence of the trajectory generated by primal dual dy nam ical system with asymptotic vanishing damping Moreover we will rediscover in case of the un constrained minimization of convex dieren ti able function with Lipschitz conti nu us gradient all convergence statements obtained in the literature for Nesterov accelerated gradient method Key Words Augmented Lagrangian method primal dual dynamical system damped in er ti al dynamics Nesterov accelerated gradient method Lyapunov analysis convergence rate trajectory convergence AMS subject classic ation

Relaxed Magnetohydrodynamics with Ideal Ohms Law Constraint Dewar Qu July Mathematical Sciences Institute The Australian National University Can be rr ACT Australia Abstract Recently new magneto id dynamics Relaxed MHD MHD was constructed using Hamilton Principle with phase space Lagrangian in corpora ting constraints of magnetic and cross he li city key die rence be tween MHD and Ideal Magnetohydrodynamics MHD is that MHD implicitly constrains the magneto id to obey the zero resistivity Ideal Ohms Law OL point wise whereas MHD discards the OL constraint completely which can violate the desideratum that all equilibrium so lu ions of MHD form subset of all IMH De qui libri The present paper lays the formal groundwork for rectifying this dec ien cy In order to im pose weak form of the OL constraint on MHD two forms of the iterative augmented Lagrangian penalty function method are proposed and discussed It is conjectured this weak form regular iz ation will allow re connection and thus avoid the formation of the singularities that plague three dimensional IMH De qui libri unie dynamical formalism is de eloped that can treat number of MHD versions Euler Lagrange qua ions and gauge invariant momentum equation in conservation form are derived in which the OL constraint contributes an external force and internal stress terms until convergence is achieved

From Canonical Correlation Analysis to Self supervised Graph Neural Networks Heng ruiZ hang Qi tian Wu Jun chi Yan David Wi pf PhilipS Yu University of Illinois at Chicago Shanghai Jiao Tong University AW Shanghai Lab hz han uic edu echo yan jun chi sj tu edu cn davi wi pf amazon com psy uic edu Abstract We introduce conceptually simple yet effective model for self supervised re pre sen ation learning with graph data It follows the previous methods that generate two views of an input graph through data augmentation However unlike contrastive methods that focus on instance level discrimination we optimize an innovative feature level objective inspired by classical Canonical Correlation Analysis Com pared with other works our approach requires none of the parameterized mutual information estimator additional projector asymmetric structures and most im port ant ly negative samples which can be costly We show that the new objective essentially aims at discarding augmentation variant information by learning invariant representations and can prevent degenerated solutions by de correlating features in different dimensions Our theoretical analysis further provides an under standing for the new objective which can be equivalently seen as an instantiation of the Information Bottleneck Principle under the self supervised setting Despite its simplicity our method performs competitively on seven public graph datasets The code is available at https it hub com heng ruiz hang CCA SG

DIRECTIONS FOR USER INTERFACE RESEARCH FROM CONSUMER VR GAMES Anthony Steed Tu uk kaM Taka la Daniel Archer Department of Computer Science Aalto University Department of Computer Science University College London Waseda University University College London Steed ucl ac uk tu uk ka taka la aalto fi Archer ucl ac uk Wallace ages Robert Lindeman School of Visual Arts HIT Lab NZ Virginia Tech University of Canterbury ages vt edu gogo hit lab nz org June ABSTRACT With the continuing development of affordable mmer sive virtual reality VR systems there is now growing market for consumer content The current form of consumer systems is not dissimilar to the lab based VR systems of the past years the primary input mechanism is ahead tracked display and one or two tracked hands with buttons and joysticks on hand held controllers Over those years very diverse academic literature has emerged that covers design and ergonomics of user interfaces DUIs However the growing consumer market has engaged very broad range of creatives that have built very diverse set of designs Sometimes these designs adopt dings from the academic literature but other times they experiment with completely novel or counter intuitive mechanisms In this paper and its online adjunct were port on novel DUI design patterns that are interesting from both design and research perspectives they are highly novel potentially broadly re usable and or suggest interesting avenues for evaluation The supplemental material which is living document is crowd sourced repository of interesting patterns This paper is curate snapshot of those patterns that were considered to be the most fruitful for further elaboration Keywords Virtual reality user interfaces games interaction patterns consumer head mounted displays

International Journal of Biostatistics YYYY op Research Article Young joo Cho Annette Molina ro Chen Hu and Robert Straw der man Regression Trees and Ensembles for Cumulative Incidence Functions https doi org sample YYYY XXXX Received Month DD YYYY revised Month DD YYYY accepted Month DD YYYY Abstract The use of cumulative incidence functions for characterizing the risk of one type of event in the presence of others has become increasingly popular over the past decade The problems of modeling estimation and inference have been treated using parametric non parametric and semi parametric methods Efforts to develop suitable extensions of machine learning methods such as regression trees and related ensemble methods have begun comparatively recently In this paper we propose novel approach to estimating cumulative incidence curves in competing risks setting using regression trees and associated ensemble estimators The proposed methods employ augmented estimators of the Brier score risk as the primary basis for building and pruning trees and lead to methods that are easily implemented using existing packages Data from the Radiation Therapy Oncology Group trial is used to illustrate these new methods Keywords Brier score CART Cause specific hazard Competing risks Fine and Gray model Random Forests Sub distribution function

Article The Pricing of Vanilla Options with Cash Dividends as Classic Vanilla Basket Option Problem here Healy Correspondence here healy proton mail com Abstract In the standard Black Scholes Merton framework dividends are represented as continuous dividend yield and the pricing of Vanilla options on stock is achieved through the well known Black Scholes formula In reality however stocks pay discrete ed cash dividend at each dividend ex date This leads to the so called piecewise log normal model where the asset jumps from axed known amount at each dividend date There is however no exact closed form formula for the pricing of Vanilla options under this model Approximations must be used While there exists many approximations taylor ed to this spec ic problem in the litterature this paper explores the use of existing well known basket option formulas for the pricing of European options on single asset with cash dividends in the piecewise log normal model Keywords European options discrete dividends quantitative nance pricing

Bot RG CN Twitter Bot Detection with Relational Graph Convolutional Networks Shang bin Feng He run Wan Ning nan Wang Minnan Luo School of Electronic and Information Engineering Xian Jiao tong University Xian China wind bin teng he run wan mr wang you stu xj tu edu cn inn luo xj tu edu cn Abstract Twitter users operated by automated programs also known as bots have increased their appearance recently and induced undesirable social effects While extensive research efforts have been devoted to the task of Twitter bot detection previous methods leverage only small fraction of user semantic and role information which leads to their failure in identifying bots that exploit multi modal user information to disguise as genuine users Apart from that the state of the art bot detectors fail to leverage user follow relationships and the graph structure it forms As result these methods fall short of capturing new generations of Twitter bots that act in groups and seem genuine individually To address these two challenges of Twitter bot de tec tion we propose Bot RG CN which is short for Bot detection with Relational Graph Convolutional Networks Bot RG CN addresses the challenge of community by constructing heterogeneous graph from follow relationships and apply relational graph convolutional networks to the Twitter sphere Apart from that Bot RG CN makes use of multi modal user semantic and property information to avoid feature engineering and augment its ability to capture bots with divers ed disguise Extensive experiments Fig Atypical Twitter bot more following than followers no background demonstrate that Bot RG CN outperforms competitive baselines image and constant comment spamming on comprehensive benchmark Twi Bot which provides follow relationships Bot RG CN is also proved to effectively leverage three modals of user information namely semantic property and neighborhood information to boost bot detection performance The rst work to detect automated accounts in social media Index Terms Twitter bot detection social media graph con dates back to Feature engineering accompanied volution al networks with traditional classier are introduced in early approaches to identify bots on Twitter These features include features

SOLVING LARGE LINEAR LEAST SQUARES WITH LINEAR EQUALITY CONSTRAINTS JENNIFER SCOTT AND MIROSLAV TUMA Abstract We consider the problem of cie ntl solving large scale linear least squares problems that have one or more linear constraints that must be satis ed exactly Whilst some classical approaches are theoretically well founded they can face di cul ties when the matrix of constraints contains dense rows or if an algorithmic transformation used in the solution process results in amo died problem that is much denser than the original one To address this we propose modi cations and new ideas with an emphasis on requiring the constraints are satis ed with small residual We examine combining the null space method with our recently developed algorithm for computing null space basis matrix for wide matrix We further show that direct elimination approach enhanced by careful pivoting can bee ect ive in transforming the problem to an un constrained sparse dense least squares problem that can be solved with existing direct or iterative methods We also present number of solution variants that employ an augmented system formulation which can be attractive when solving sequence of related problems Numerical experiments using problems coming from practical applications are used throughout to demonstrate the eec ti ve ness of the die rent approaches Key words sparse matrices linear least squares problems linear equality constraints null space method

Characteristic Mapping Method for Transport on the Sphere Seth Taylor Jean Christophe Nave Department of Mathematics and Statistics McGill University Montreal Quebec Canada Abstract semi Lagrangian method for the solution of the transport equation on sphere is presented The method evolves the inverse ow map using the Char act eris tic Mapping CM and Gradient Augmented Level Set GALS frameworks Transport of the ad vec ted quantity is then computed by com po it ion with the numerically approximated inverse ow map This framework allows for the advection of complicated sets and multiple quantities with ar bit rar ly ne features using coarse computational grid We discuss the CM method for linear transport on the sphere and its computational implement tion Standard test cases for solid body rotation deformation al and divergent ow and numerical mixing are presented The unique features of the method are demonstrated by the transport of multi scale function and fractal set in complex ow environment Keywords Advection Flow map Arbitrary Resolution Characteristic Mapping method Gradient Augmented Level set method

Fit Vid Overt ting in Pixel Level Video Prediction Mohammad Baba ei za deh Mohammad Tag hiS af far Suraj Nair Google Brain Google Brain Stanford University bz google com msa far google com suraj stanford edu Sergey Levine Chelsea Finn Du mi truE rh an Google Brain Google Brain Google Brain levine google com chelsea google com dum it ru google com Abstract An agent that is capable of predicting what happens next can perform variety of tasks through planning with no additional training Furthermore such an agent can internally represent the complex dynamics of the real world and therefore can acquire representation useful for variety of visual perception tasks This makes predicting the future frames of video conditioned on the observed past and potentially future actions an interesting task which remains exceptionally challenging despite many recent advances Existing video prediction models have shown promising results on simple narrow benchmarks but they generate low quality predictions on real life datasets with more complicated dynamics or broader domain There is growing body of evidence that under ting on the training data is one of the primary causes for the low quality predictions In this paper we argue that the in efc ent use of parameters in the current video models is the main reason for under ting Therefore we introduce new architecture named Fit Vid which is capable of severe overt ting on the common benchmarks while having similar parameter count as the current state of the art models We analyze the consequences of overt ting illustrating how it can produce unexpected outcomes such as generating high quality output by repeating the training data and how it can be mitigated using existing image augmentation techniques As result Fit Vid outperforms the current state of the art models across four different video prediction benchmarks on four different metrics

Disease Progression Modeling Workbench Part has ara thy Surya narayan an Pri th wish Chakra bor ty Pi yu sh Madan Kibi chi Bore William gallo Ra chita Chandra Mohamed hal wash Italo Bu le je Seko Remy Shilpa Mahatma Pablo Meyer Jian ying Hu Center for Computational Health IBM Research NY USA IBM Research Nairobi Kenya Background Disease Progression Modeling DPM aims to characterize the progression of disease and its com or bidi ties over time using wide range of analytics models including disease staging patient trajectory analytics prediction and time to event estimations for key disease related events DPM has applications throughout the healthcare ecosystem from providers decision support for patient staging to payers care management and pharmaceutical companies clinical trial enrichment But the complexity of building effective DPM models can be road block for their rapid experimentation and adoption Some of this is addressed by standardization of data model and tooling for data analysis and cohorts election However there are still un met needs to facilitate the development of advanced machine learning techniques such as deep learning with additional requirements such as experiment tracking and reproducibility Furthermore to accelerate DPM research data scientists available tools should include framework for deploying models as cloud ready micro services for rapid prototyping and dissemination In this demonstration we introduce Disease Progression Modeling Workbench DPM opensource project https ibm it hub io DPM DPM is an easy to install system to help research and development of DPM models Figure It manages the entire modeling lifecycle from data analysis co hort ident cation to machine learning algorithm development and prototyping DPM augments the advantages of data model standardization and tooling MOP CD Athena ATLAS provided by the widely adopted OH DSI in ti at ive with powerful machine learning training framework and mechanism for rapid prototyping through automatic deployment of models as container zed services into cloud environment This enables quicker and ex ble imp le ment ation and validation of the models Figure DPM Component View Methods The architecture shown in Figure has four main components Lightsaber an extensible training framework which provides blueprints for the development of disease pr ogres sion models DPM It is designed ground up using state of the art opensource tools to provide simple modular and unie model training framework to support some of the common use cases for DPM Lightsaber contains four key modules data ingestion modules to support standardized methods of ingesting data model trainers to support standardized model training incorporating best practices metrics to support pre built DPM problems pec ic model evaluation in built model tracking and support for post hoc model evaluation by integrating with Model Registry Users can select spec ic modules and integrate them into their modeling work ow Lightsaber also comes with reusable library of state of the art machine and deep learning algorithms for DPM STM for in hospital mortality predictions Lightsaber integrates naturally with ATLAS using client called Lightsaber Client for ATLAS LC enabling au to mated extraction of features from the OMO PCD model thus complementing the ease and ex bil it of de ning standardized cohorts using ATLAS graphical user interface with the ability to quickly develop deep learning al go

PHYSICS PERCEPTION IN SLOSHING SCENES WITH GUARANTEED THERMODYNAMIC CONSISTENCY PRE PRINT Beat rizM oya Alberto Badia Aragon Institute in Engineering Research Aragon Institute in Engineering Research University of Zaragoza University of Zaragoza Zaragoza Spain Zaragoza Spain beam uni zar es badia uni zar es David Gonzalez Francisco Chin esta Aragon Institute in Engineering Research ES Group chair PIM Lab University of Zaragoza EN SAM Institute of Technology Zaragoza Spain Paris France gonz al uni zar es francisco chin esta en sam eu Elias Cue to Aragon Institute in Engineering Research University of Zaragoza Zaragoza Spain cue to uni zar es June ABSTRACT Physics perception very often faces the problem that only limited data or partial measurements on the scene are available In this work we propose strategy to learn the full state of sloshing liquids from measurements of the free surface Our approach is based on recurrent neural networks RN that project the limited information available to reduced order manifold so as to not only reconstruct the unknown information but also to be capable of performing id reasoning about future scenarios in real time To obtain physically consistent predictions we train deep neural networks on the reduced order manifold that through the employ of inductive biases ensure the full ment of the principles of thermodynamics RN Ns learn from history the required hidden information to correlate the limited information with the latent space where the simulation occurs Finally decoder returns data back to the high dimensional manifold so as to provide the user with insightful information in the form of augmented reality This algorithm is connected to computer vision system to test the performance of the proposed methodology with real information resulting in system capable of understanding and predicting future states of the observed id in real time Keywords Physics perception thermodynamics aware deep learning GENERIC sloshing

Investigating Modes of Activity and Guidance Investigating Modes of Activity and Guidance for Mediating Museum Exhibits in Mixed Reality Katrin Glinka Humboldt Universit zu Berlin Berlin katrin glinka hu berlin de Patrick Tobias Fischer Claudia ller Bir Freie Universit Berlin Berlin patrick tobias fischer fu berlin de cl mb in fu berlin de Silk roh Stiftung Preu is cher Kul tur be itz Berlin roh smb pk berlin de Abstract We present an exploratory case study describing the design and real ation of pure mixed reality application in museum setting where we investigate the potential of using Microsoft Hol oLen for object centred museum mediation Our prototype supports non expert visitors observing sculpture by offering interpretation that is linked to visual properties of the museum object The design and development of our research prototype is based on two stage visitor observation study and formative study we conducted prior to the design of the application We present summary of our findings from these studies and explain how they have influenced our user centred content creation and the interaction design of our prototype We are specifically interested in investigating to what extent different constructs of initiative influence the learning and user experience Thus we detail three modes of act vit that we realised in our prototype Our case study is informed by research in the area of human computer interaction the humanities and museum practice Accordingly we discuss core concepts such as gaze based interaction object centred learning presence and modes of activity and guidance with trans disciplinary perspective

MARS second order reduction algorithm for high dimensional sparse precision matrices estimation Qian Li qian li connect poly hk Department of Applied Mathematics The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Hung Hom Kowloon Hong Kong Bin yan Jiang by jiang poly edu hk Department of Applied Mathematics The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Hung Hom Kowloon Hong Kong De feng Sun de feng sun poly edu hk Department of Applied Mathematics The Hong Kong Polytechnic University Hung Hom Kowloon Hong Kong Abstract Estimation of the precision matrix or inverse co variance matrix is of great importance in statistical data analysis However as the number of parameters scales quadratically with the dimension computation becomes very challenging when is large In this paper we propose an adaptive sieving reduction algorithm to generate solution path for the estimation of precision matrices under the cid penalized trace loss with each sub problem being solved by second order algorithm In each iteration of our algorithm we are able to greatly reduce the number of variables in the problem based on the Ka rush Kuhn Tucker KT conditions and the sparse structure of the estimated precision matrix in the previous iteration As result our algorithm is capable of handling datasets with very high dimensions that may go beyond the capacity of the existing methods Moreover for the sub problem in each iteration other than solving the primal problem directly we develop semi smooth Newton augmented Lagrangian algorithm with global linear convergence on the dual problem to improve the ec ien cy Theoretical properties of our proposed algorithm have been established In particular we show that the convergence rate of our algorithm is asymptotically super linear The high ec ien cy and promising performance of our algorithm are illustrated via extensive simulation studies and real data applications with comparison to several state of the art solvers Keywords Adaptive sieving reduction Precision matrix Semi smooth Newton Sparsity Solution path

Feature Grouping and Sparse Principal Component Analysis Hai yan Jiang Shan shan Qin De jing Dou Baidu Research Baidu Inc China jiang hai yan do ude jing baidu com School of Statistics Tianjin University of Finance and Economics Tianjin China qin ssl zu gmail com Abstract Sparse Principal Component Analysis SPC is widely used in data processing and dimension reduction it uses the lasso to produce mo died principal com pon ents with sparse loading for better interpret ability However sparse PCA never considers an additional grouping structure where the loading share similar coe fci ents feature grouping besides special group with all coe fci ents being zero features election In this paper we propose novel method called Feature Grouping and Sparse Principal Component Analysis GSPC which allows the loading to belong to disjoint homogeneous groups with sparsity as special case The proposed GSPC is subspace learning method designed to simultaneously perform grouping pursuit and features election by imposing non convex regular iz ation with naturally adjustable sparsity and grouping effect To solve the resulting non convex optimization problem we propose an alternating algorithm that incorporates the difference of convex programming augmented Lagrange and coordinate descent methods Additionally the experimental results on real datasets show that the proposed GSPC be nets from the grouping effect compared with methods without grouping effect Keywords SPC Dimension Reduction Feature Grouping Sparsity Feature Selection

CADD Class wise Automatic Differentiable Data Augmentation for EG Signals Cd ric Rommel Thomas Moreau In ria CEA In ria CEA Universit Paris clay Universit Paris clay cedric rommel in ria fr thomas moreau in ria fr Alexandre Gram fort In ria CEA Universit Paris clay alexandre gram fort in ria fr Abstract Data augmentation is key element of deep learning pipelines as it in forms the network during training about transformations of the input data that keep the label unchanged Manually ding adequate augmentation methods and parameters for given pipeline is however rapidly cumbersome In particular while intuition can guide this decision for images the design and choice of augmentation policies remains unclear for more complex types of data such as neuroscience signals Moreover label independent strategies might not be suitable for such structured data and class dependent augmentations might be necessary This idea has been surprisingly unexplored in the literature while it is quite intuitive changing the color of car image does not change the object class to be predicted but doing the same to the picture of an orange does This paper aims to increase the generalization power added through class wise data augmentation Yet as seeking transformations depending on the class largely increases the complexity of the task using gradient free optimization techniques as done by most existing automatic approaches becomes intractable for real world datasets For this reason we propose to use differentiable data augmentation amenable to gradient based learning EG signals area perfect example of data for which good augmentation policies are Xi mostly unknown In this work we demonstrate the relevance of our approach on the clinically relevant sleep staging classic ation task for which we also propose differentiable transformations

Recurrent Coupled Topic Modeling over Sequential Documents IN IN GUO State Key Lab of oTS and Department of Computer and Information Science University of Macau China LONG BING CAO Data Science Lab University of Technology Sydney Australia ZHI GUO GONG State Key Lab of oTS and Department of Computer and Information Science University of Macau China The abundant sequential documents such as online archival social media and news feeds are stream ingly updated where each chunk of documents is incorporated with smoothly evolving yet dependent topics Such digital texts have attracted extensive research on dynamic topic modeling to infer hidden evolving topics and their temporal dependencies However most of the existing approaches focus on single topic thread evolution and ignore the fact that current topic maybe coupled with multiple relevant prior topics In addition these approaches also incur the intractable inference problem when inferring latent parameters resulting in high computational cost and performance degradation In this work we assume that current topic evolves from all prior topics with corresponding coupling weights forming the multi topic thread evolution Our method models the dependencies between evolving topics and thoroughly encodes their complex multi couplings across time steps To conquer the intractable inference challenge new solution with set of novel data augmentation techniques is proposed which successfully discomposes the multi couplings between evolving topics fully conjugate model is thus obtained to guarantee the effectiveness and efficiency of the inference technique novel Gibbs sampler with backward forward filter algorithm efficiently learns latent time evolving parameters in closed form In addition the latent Indian Buffet Process BP compound distribution is exploited to automatically infer the overall topic number and customize the sparse topic proportions for each sequential document without bias The proposed method is evaluated on both synthetic and real world datasets against the competitive baselines demonstrating its superiority over the baselines in terms of the low per word perplexity high coherent topics and better document time prediction CCS Concepts Mathematics of computing Probabilistic inference problems Gibbs sampling Non parametric statistics Information systems Document topic models Additional Single Image Texture Translation for Data Augmentation Boy iLi Yin Cui sung iL in Serge Belong ie Cornell University Cornell Tech Google Research Brain Team Abstract Bubble milk Milk Augmented bubble milk Recent advances in image synthesis enables one to trans late images by learning the mapping between source do main and target domain Existing methods tend to learn the distributions by training model on variety of datasets with results evaluated largely in subjective manner Rel iv ely few works in this area however study the potential use of semantic image translation methods for image recognition tasks In this paper we explore the use of Single Image Figure NE embedding before and after applying IT Left Texture Translation IT for data augmentation We rst milk red and bubble milk blue images Right corresponding propose lightweight model for translating texture to images augmented bubble milk gray and original bubble milk images based on single input of source texture allowing for fast training and testing Based on IT we then explore the use of augmented data in long tailed and few shot image classic ation tasks Wend the proposed method is capable of translating input data into target domain leading to consistent improved image recognition performance Finally we examine how IT and related image translation meth Real House Sparrow IT Par uli dae od can provide basis for data efc ent augmentation engineering approach to model training

Scene Uncertainty and the Wellington Posterior of Deterministic Image Classier Stephanie Tsu ei Aditya Gol at kar Department of Computer Science Department of Computer Science UCLA Los Angeles CA UCLA Los Angeles CA stephanie tsu ei ucla edu aditya cs ucla edu Stefano So at to Department of Computer Science UCLA Los Angeles CA so at to ucla edu Abstract We propose method to estimate the uncertainty of the outcome of an image classier on given input datum Deep neural networks commonly used for image classic ation are deterministic maps from an input image to an output class As such their outcome on given datum involves no uncertainty so we must specify what variability we are referring to when de ning measuring and interpreting conde ce To this end we introduce the Wellington Posterior which is the distribution of outcomes that would have been obtained in response to data that could have been generated by the same scene that produced the given image Since there are inn it ely many scenes that could have generated the given image the Wellington Posterior requires induction from scenes other than the one portrayed We explore alternate methods using data augmentation ense bling and model linear iz ation Additional alternatives include generative adversarial networks conditional prior networks and supervised single view reconstruction We test these alternatives against the empirical posterior obtained by inferring the class of temporally adjacent frames in video These developments are only small step towards assessing the reliability of deep network classier in manner that is compatible with safety critical applications

Rise of the Autonomous Machines Shao shan Liu Senior Member IEEE Jean Luc Gaudi ot Life Fellow IEEE Perce pt In Inc University of California Irvine Abstract After decades of uninterrupted progress and growth information technology has so evolved that it can be said we are entering the age of autonomous machines but there exist many roadblocks in the way of making this reality In this article we make preliminary attempt at recognizing and categorizing the technical and non technical challenges of autonomous machines for each of the ten areas we have identified we review current status roadblocks and potential research directions It is hoped that this will help the community define clear effective and more formal development goalposts for the future The Age of Autonomous Machines The Sixth Layer of Information Technology As an increasing number and kinds of autonomous machines enter our daily life the age of autonomous machines is upon us and whole new era of information technology begins How did we get here Before delving into autonomous machines let us first review the evolution of computing machinery Information technology took off in the when Fairchild Semiconductors and Intel established its foundation by producing the first silicon microprocessors with the attendant explosive growth of the Silicon Valley See Figure At first although microprocessor technologies greatly improved industrial productivity the general public had limited access to it This changed in the with the advent of personal computers and later Apple Macintosh and Microsoft Windows using Graphical User Interface GUI The second layer had been laid and the vision of ubiquitous computers targeted for use by untrained personnel at home had become possibility With virtually everyone having access to computing power by the early Yahoo and Google laid the third layer connecting people indirectly with information available through search engines With the third layer the internet core infrastructure to enable later layers could become ubiquitous Beginning with Facebook in social networking sites created the fourth layer of information technology by allowing people to directly connect with each other effectively moving the whole of human society to the World Wide Web

ANDERSON ACCELERATED AUGMENTED LAGRANGIAN FOR EXTENDED WAVEFORM IN VERSION PRE PRINT KamalA ghaz de Institute of Geophysics University of Tehran Tehran Iran ghaz de kamal ut ac ir Ali Ghola mi Institute of Geophysics University of Tehran Tehran Iran ghola mi ut ac ir Hossein Agha iry University Cote Azur CNRS RD OCA Geo azur Val bonne France agha iry geo azur nice fr Stephane Oper to University Cote Azur CNRS RD OCA Geo azur Val bonne France oper to geo azur nice fr June ABSTRACT The augmented Lagrangian AL method provides ex ble and efc ent framework for so lv ing extended space full waveform in version FW constrained nonlinear optimization problem whereby we seek model parameters and wave lds that minimize the data residuals and satisfy the wave equation constraint The AL based wave el reconstruction in version also known as it er at iv ely re ned wave el reconstruction in version extends the search space of FW in the source dimension and decreases sensitivity of the in version to the initial model accuracy Furthermore it be nets from the advantages of the alternating direction method of multipliers AD MM such as generality and de com pos ability for dealing with non differentiable regularize rs total variation regular iz ation and large scale problems respectively In practice any extension of the method aim in gat improving its convergence and decreasing the number of wave equation solves would have great importance To achieve this goal were cast the method as general ed point iteration pro lem which enables us to apply sophisticated acceleration strategies like Anderson acceleration The accelerated algorithm stores pre de ned number of previous iterates and uses their linear comb in tion together with the current iteration to predict the next iteration We investigate the performance of the proposed accelerated algorithm on simple checkerboard model and the benchmark Mar mou si II and BP salt models through numerical examples These numerical results con rm the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm in terms of convergence rate and the quality of the nal estimated model

Effects of Head locked Augmented Reality on Users Performance and Perceived Workload alda has emi An kit Singh Myung hee Kim Andrew Johnson and He ej in Jeong University of Illinois at Chicago An augmented reality AR environment includes set of digital elements with which the users interact while performing certain tasks Recent AR head mounted displays allow users to select how these elements are presented However few studies have been conducted to examine the effect of presenting augmented content on user performance and workload This study aims to evaluate two methods of presenting augmented content world locked and head locked modes in data entry task total of eighteen participants performed the data entry task in this study The effectiveness of each mode is evaluated in terms of task performance muscle activity perceived workload and usability The results show that the task completion time is shorter and the typing speed is significantly faster in the head locked mode while the world locked mode achieved higher scores in terms of preference The findings of this study can be applied to AR user interfaces to improve content presentation and enhance the user experience

This is pre publication version of the published book chapter in City Modelling from sensors to applications The final contents are subject to minor edits Chapter Geometric Processing for Image based Object Modeling Rong jun Qin Xu Huang Department of Civil Environmental and Geodetic Engineering Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering Translational Data Analytics Institute The Ohio State University Neil Avenue Columbus Ohio USA Abstract Image based object modeling refers to the process of converting raw optical images to digital representations of the objects Very often such models are desired to be dimensionally true semantically labeled with photo realistic appearance reality based modeling Laser scanning was deemed as the standard and direct way to obtaining highly accurate measurements of objects while one would have to abide the high acquisition cost and its un availability on some of the platforms Nowadays the image based methods backbone by the recently developed advanced dense image matching algorithms and geo referencing paradigms are becoming the dominant approaches due to its high flexibility availability and low cost The largely automated geometric processing of images in object reconstruction work flow from ordered unordered raw imagery to textured meshes is becoming critical part of the reality based modeling This article summarizes the overall geometric processing work flow with focuses on introducing the state of the art methods of three major components of geometric processing geo referencing Image dense matching texture mapping Finally we will draw conclusions and share our outlooks of the topics discussed in this article

Measuring close proximity interactions in summer camps during the OVID pandemic Leoni enc etti Sant in Is tom in Molteni Pic co Far ella Le pri and Murphy DIG IS Bruno Kessler Foundation Trento Italy DEI Universit di Bologna Bologna Italy IS Universit di Trento Trento Italy June Abstract Policymakers have implemented multiple non pharmaceuticals rate gies to mitigate the OVID worldwide crisis Interventions had the aim of reducing close proximity interactions which drive the spread of the disease deeper knowledge of human physical interactions has revealed necessary especially in all settings involving children whose education and gathering activities should be preserved Despite their relevance almost no data are available on close proximity contacts among children in schools or other educational settings during the pandemic Contact data are usually gathered via Bluetooth which none the less ers low temporal and spatial resolution Recently ultra wide band WB radios emerged as more accurate alternative that nonetheless exhibits sign cant ly higher energy consumption lim it ing in el studies In this paper we leverage novel approach embodied by the Janus system that combines these radios by exploit ing their complementary be nets The very accurate proximity data leoni fbk eu

Efc ent Maximum Likelihood Decoding of Polar Codes Over the Binary Erasure Channel Yon at an Urm an and David Burs te in School of Electrical Engineering Tel Aviv University Tel Aviv Israel Email yon at anur man mail tau ac il burst yn eng tau ac il Abstract new algorithm for efc ent exact maximum like li hood decoding of polar codes which maybe CRC augmented transmitted over the binary erasure channel is presented The algorithm applies matrix triangulation process on sparse polar code parity check matrix followed by solving small size linear system over GF To implement the matrix triangulation we apply belief propagation decoding type operations We also indicate how this decoder can be implemented in parallel for low latency decoding Numerical simulations are used to evaluate the performance and computational complexity of the new algorithm

International Journal of Quantum Foundations Original Paper Violation of Bell Inequalities Mapping the Conceptual Implications Brian Drummond Edinburgh Scotland mail drummond work phone coop coop Received April Accepted June Published June Abstract This short article concentrates on the conceptual aspects of the violation of Bell inequalities and acts as map to the cited references The article outlines relevant characteristics of quantum mechanics such as statistical balance and entanglement the thinking that led to the derivation of the original Bell inequality and the range of claimed implications including realism locality and others which attract less attention The main conclusion is that violation of Bell inequalities appears to have some implications for the nature of physical reality but that none of these are de nite The violations constrain possible pre quantum underlying theories but do not rule out the possibility that such theories might reconcile at least one understanding of locality and realism to quantum mechanical predictions Violation might re ect at least partly failure to acknowledge the contextual it of quantum mechanics or that data from different probability spaces have been inappropriately combined Many claims that there are de nite implications re ect one or more of imprecise non mathematical language ii assumptions inappropriate in quantum mechanics iii inadequate treatment of measurement statistics and iv underlying philosophical assumptions Keywords Bell inequalities statistical balance entanglement realism locality pre quantum theories contextual it probability space conceptual philosophical

WEIGHTED NARY BINARY TREES HEX TREES AND HORTON STRA HLER NUMBERS REVISITED HELMUT PRO DINGER Abstract Hex trees are den tied as particular instance of weighted nary binary trees The Horton Stra hler numbers of these objects are revisited and thanks to substitution that is not very intuitive explicit results are possible They are aug men ted by asymptotic evaluations as well Binary trees and Horton Stra hler numbers Binary trees may be expressed by the following symbolic equation which says that they include the empty tree and trees recursively built from root followed by two subtree which are binary trees cid Binary trees are counted by Catalan numbers and there is an important parameter reg which in Computer Science is called the register function It associates to each binary tree which is used to code an arithmetic expression with data in the leaves and operators in the internal nodes the minimal number of extra registers that is needed to evaluate the tree The optimal strategy is to evaluate di cult subtree rst and use one register to keep its value which does not hurt if the other subtree requires less registers If both subtree are equally di cult then one more register is used compared to the requirements of the subtree This natural parameter is among Combinatorial is ts known as the Horton Stra hler numbers and we will adopt this name throughout this paper There is recursive description of this function reg cid and if tree th as subtree and then max reg reg if reg reg reg reg otherwise The recursive description attaches numbers to the nodes starting with at the leaves and then going up the number appearing at the root is the Horton Stra hler number of the tree Date June

Data set Bias Mitigation Through Analysis of CNN Training Scores Ek ber jan Der man Department of Computer Science Saba nc University Tuzla Istanbul Turkey der man saba nci un iv edu Abstract Training datasets are crucial for convolutional neural network based algorithms which directly impact their overall performance As such using well structured data set that has minimum level of bias is always desirable In this paper we proposed novel domain independent approach called score based re sampling BR to locate the under represented samples of the original training data set based on the model prediction scores obtained with that training set In our method once trained we use the same CNN model to infer on its own training samples obtain prediction scores and based on the distance between predicted and ground truth we identify samples that are far away from their ground truth and augment them in the original training set The temperature term of the igm oid function is decreased to better differentiate scores For experimental evaluation we selected one Ka gg le data set for gender classification We first used CNN based class fier with relatively standard structure trained on the training images and evaluated on the provided validation samples of the original data set Then we assessed it on totally new test data set consisting of light male light female dark male and dark female groups The obtained ac curacies varied revealing the existence of categorical bias against certain groups in the original data set Subsequently we trained the model after re sampling based on our proposed approach We compared our method with previously proposed variation al auto encoder VA based algorithm The obtained results confirmed the validity of our proposed method re grading identifying under represented samples among original data set to decrease categorical bias of classifying certain groups Although tested for gender classification the proposed algorithm can be used for investigating data set structure of any CNN based tasks Keywords data imbalance data augmentation convolutional neural network variation al auto encoder algorithmic bias

Data augmentation for deep learning based accelerated MRI reconstruction with limited data Zal an Fabian Reinhard Heckel Mahdi Sol tan ol kota bi June Abstract Deep neural networks have emerged as very successful tools for image restoration and reconstruction tasks These networks are often trained end to end to directly reconstruct an image from noisy or corrupted measurement of that image To achieve state of the art performance training on large and diverse sets of images is considered critical However it is often di cult and or expensive to collect large amounts of training images Inspired by the success of Data Augmentation DA for classic ation problems in this paper we propose pipeline for data augmentation for accelerated MRI reconstruction and study it see ct ive ness at reducing the required training data in variety of settings Our DA pipeline MR Augment is spec ic ally designed to utilize the in variances present in medical imaging measurements as naive DA strategies that neglect the physics of the problem fail Through extensive studies on multiple datasets we demonstrate that in the low data regime DA prevents overt ting and can match or even surpass the state of the art while using sign cant ly fewer training data whereas in the high data regime it has diminishing returns Furthermore our dings show that DA can improve the robustness of the model against various shifts in the test distribution

Untidy Data The Unreasonable Effectiveness of Tables Lyn Bar tram Michael orrell and Melanie Tory Fig An example spreadsheet shared with permission of Cornerstone Architects showing various rich table features that our participants employed including Master Table of based at that is often left untouched with manipulations happening in copy or other area separate from the based at Marginalia such as comments or derived rows or columns in the periphery of the base table often taking the form of freeform natural language comments Annotations such as highlighting or characters with spec ic meaning dash denotes missing values to ag particular cells as anomalous or requiring action and Multi cell features such as labels or even data that span multiple rows or columns of the sheet Abstract Working with data in table form is usually considered preparatory and tedious step in the sense making pipeline away of getting the data ready for more sophisticated visualization and analytical tools But for many people spreadsheets the quintessential table tool remain critical part of their information ecosystem allowing them to interact with their data in ways that are hidden or abstracted in more complex tools This is particularly true for data workers people who work with data as part of their job but do not identify as professional analysts or data scientists Were port on qualitative study of how these workers interact with and reason about their data Our dings show that data tables serve broader purpose beyond data cleanup at the initial stage of linear analytic ow users want to see and get their hands on the underlying data throughout the analytics process reshaping and augmenting it to support sense making They reorganize markup layer on levels of detail and spawn alternatives within the context of the based at These direct interactions and human readable table representations form rich and cognitive ly important part of building understanding of what the data mean and what they can do with it We argue that interactive tables are an important visualization idiom in their own right that the direct data interaction they afford offers fertile design space for visual analytics and that sense making can be enriched by more ex ble human data interaction than is currently supported in visual analytics tools Index Terms Data practices Tabular data Interview study Visualization Analytics Data workers Sense making

novel augmented Lagrangian method of multipliers for optimization with general inequality constraints in Wei Liu Yu Hong Dai Ya Kui Huang and Jie Sun June Abstract We introduce twice dieren ti able augmented Lagrangian for nonlinear optimization with general inequality constraints and show that strict local minimize of the original problem is an ap proximate strict local solution of the augmented Lagrangian novel augmented Lagrangian method of multipliers ALM is then presented Our method is originated from generalization of the He ten es Powell augmented Lagrangian and is combination of the augmented Lagrangian and the interior point technique It shares similar algorithmic framework with existing ALMs for optimization with inequality constraints but it can use the second derivatives and does not depend on projections on the set of in equal it constraints In each iteration our method solves twice continuously dieren ti able un constrained optimization sub problem on primal variables The dual iterates penalty and smoothing parameters are updated adaptively The global and local convergence are analyzed Without assuming any constraint qu ali cation it is proved that the proposed method has strong global convergence The method may converge to either Kur ash Kuhn Tucker KT point or singular stationary point when the con verg ing point is minimize It may also converge to an infeasible stationary point of nonlinear program when the problem is infeasible Furthermore our method is capable of rapidly detecting the possible in feasibility of the solved problem Under suitable conditions it is locally linearly convergent to the KT point which is consistent with ALMs for optimization with equality constraints The preliminary numerical experiments on some small benchmark test problems demonstrate our theoretical results Keywords Nonlinear programming inequality constrained optimization augmented Lagrangian method of multipliers strong global convergence local convergence AMS subject classic at ions Institute of Mathematics Hebei University of Technology Tianjin China mail math he but edu cn The research is supported by theN FC grants nos and Academy Logistic tree normal model for micro biome compositions Zhuo qu Wang Jia liang Mao Li Ma Duke University Linked In Corporation Duke University Durham NC Sunnyvale CA Durham NC June Abstract We introduce probabilistic model called the logistic tree normal LT for micro biome compositional data The LT marries two popular classes of models the logistic normal LN and the Di rich let tree DT and inherits the key be nets of both LN models are ex ble in characterizing rich co variance structure among taxa but can be computationally prohibitive in face of high dimensionality when the number of taxa is large due to its lack of con ju gacy to the multi no mi al sampling model On the other hand the DT avoids this issue by decomposing the multi no mi al sampling model into collection of binomial models one at each split of the phylogenetic tree of the taxa and adopting conjugate beta model for each binomial probability but at the same time the DT incurs restrictive co variance among the taxa In contrast the LT model decomposes the multi no mi al model into binomials as the DT does but it jointly models the corresponding binomial probabilities using multivariate LN distribution instead of betas It therefore allows rich co variance structures as the LN models while the binomial decomposition of the multi no mi al likelihood allows con ju gacy to be restored through the Polya Gamma augmentation Accordingly Bayesian inference on the LT model can readily proceed by Gibbs sampling Moreover the multivariate Gaussian aspect of the model allows common techniques for eec ti ve inference on high dimensional data such as those based on sparsity and low rank assumptions in the co variance structure to be readily incorporated Depending on the goal of the analysis the LT model can be used either as standalone model or embedded into more sophisticated hierarchical models We demonstrate its use in estimating taxa co variance and in ii mixed eec ts modeling Finally we carry out case study using an LT based mixed eec ts model to analyze longitudinal data set from the cohort of the DIAB IMMUNE project Email li ma duke edu

Making the most of small Software Engineering datasets with modern machine learning Julian Aron Pre nner Romain Rob be Abstract This paper provides starting point for Software Engineering SE researchers and practitioners faced with the problem of training machine learning models on small datasets Due to the high costs associated with labeling data in Software Engineering there exist many small samples and medium sized samples datasets While deep learning has set the state of the art in many machine learning tasks it is only recently that it has proven effective on small sized datasets primarily thanks to pre training semi supervised learning technique that leverages abundant un labelled data alongside scarce labelled data In this work we evaluate pre trained Transformer models on selection of smaller datasets from theSE literature covering both source code and natural language Our results suggest that pre trained Transformers are competitive and in some cases superior to previous models especially for tasks involving natural language whereas for source code tasks in particular for very small datasets traditional machine learning methods often has the edge In addition we experiment with several techniques that ought to aid training on small datasets including active learning data augmentation soft labels self training and intermediate task ne tuning and issue recommendations on when they are effective We also release all the data scripts and most importantly pre trained models for the community to reuse on their own datasets Index Terms Small Datasets Transformer BERT RoBERTA Pre training Fine Tuning Data Augmentation Back Translation Soft Labels Active Learning cid

Rethinking the Evaluation of Neural Machine Translation Jian hao Yan Chen ming Wu Fan dong Meng We Chat Tencent China Tencent China We Chat Tencent China elliott yan tencent com william wu tencent com fan dong meng tencent com Jie Zhou We Chat Tencent China with tom zhou tencent com Abstract The evaluation of neural machine translation systems is usually built upon generated translation of certain decoding method beam search with evaluation metrics over the generated translation BLEU However this evaluation framework suffers from high search errors brought by heuristic search algorithms and is limited by its nature of evaluation over one best candidate In this paper we propose novel evaluation protocol which not only avoids the effect of search errors but provides system level evaluation in the perspective of model ranking In particular our method is based on our newly proposed exact top decoding instead of beam search Our approach evaluates model errors by the distance between the candidate spaces scored by the references and the model respectively Extensive experiments on MT English German demonstrate that bad ranking ability is connected to the well known beam search curse and state of the art Transformer models are facing serious ranking errors By evaluating various model architectures and techniques we provide several interesting dings Finally to effectively approximate the exact search algorithm with sametime costas original beam search we present minimum heap augmented beam search algorithm

ELECTROMAGNETIC ANALYSIS OF AN ULTRA LIGHTWEIGHT CIPHER PRESENT Nil up lee Gun at hi lake Ahmed Al Dubai William Buchanan Owen Lo Block pass ID Lab School of Computing Edinburgh Napier University UK School of Computing Edinburgh Napier University UK ABSTRACT Side channel attacks are an unpredictable risk factor in cryptography Therefore continuous observations of physical leakages are essential to minimise vulnerabilities associated with cryptographic functions Lightweight cryptography is novel approach in progress towards internet of things oT security Thus it would provide sufficient data and privacy protection in such constrained ecosystem oT devices are resource limited in terms of data rates in kbps power maintainability battery as well as hardware and software footprints physical size internal memory RAM ROM Due to the difficulty in handling conventional cryptographic algorithms lightweight ciphers consist of small key sizes block sizes and few operational rounds Unlike in the past afford ability to perform side channel attacks using inexpensive electronic circuit ries is becoming reality Hence cryptanalysis of physical leakage in these emerging ciphers is crucial Among existing studies power analysis seems to have enough attention in research whereas other aspects such as electromagnetic timing cache and optical attacks continue to be appropriately evaluated to play role in forensic analysis As result we started analysing electromagnetic emission leakage of an ultra lightweight block cipher PRESENT According to the literature PRESENT promises to be adequate for oT devices and there still seems not to exist any work regarding correlation electromagnetic analysis CEM of it Firstly we conducted simple electromagnetic analysis in both time and frequency domains and then proceeded towards CEM attack modelling This paper provides summary of the related literature oT lightweight cryptography side channel attacks and EMA our methodology current outcomes and future plans for the optimised results KEYWORDS Side channel attacks electromagnetic analysis lightweight cryptography PRESENT and oT

CAN BANK BENCHMARK DATA SET FOR FIGURE EXTRACTION FROM SCANNED ELECTRONIC THESE AND DISSERTATIONS Sampan na Yash want Kah William Ingram Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering Department of Computer Science Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Blacksburg VA Blacksburg VA sampan na vt edu wain gram vt edu Edward Fox Jian Wu Department of Computer Science Department of Computer Science Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University Old Dominion University Blacksburg VA Norfolk VA fox vt edu jwu cs odu edu ABSTRACT We focus on electronic these and dissertations TDs aiming to improve access and expand their utility since more than million are publicly available and they constitute an important corpus to aid research and education across disciplines The corpus is growing as newborn digital documents are included and since millions of older these and dissertations have been converted to digital form to be disseminated electronically in institutional repositories In TDs as with other scholarly works gur es and tables can communicate large amount of information in concise way Although methods have been proposed for extracting gur es and tables from born digital PDFs they do not work well with scanned TDs Considering this problem our assessment of state of the art gu re extraction systems is that the reason they do not function well on scanned PDFs is that they have only been trained on born digital documents To address this limitation we presentS can Bank new data set containing thousands canned page images manually labeled by humans as to the presence of the thousand gu resort able found there in We use this data set to train deep neural network model based on YO LOv to accurately extract gur es and tables from scanned TDs We pose and answer important research questions aimed at ding better methods for gu re extraction from scanned documents One of those concerns the value for training of data augmentation techniques applied to born digital documents which are used to train models better suited for gu re extraction from scanned documents To the best of our knowledge can Bank is the rst manually annotated data set for gu re and table extraction for scanned TDs YO LOv based model trained on can Bank outperforms existing comparable open source and freely available baseline methods by considerable margin Keywords Data set Digital Libraries Deep Neural Networks YO LOv Figure Extraction Electronic These and Dissertations

DUE TAL WHERE IS THE DISEASE Where is the disease Semi supervised pseudo normality synthesis from an abnormal image Yuan qi Du George Mason University du mu edu Institute of Computing Technology Chi Quan Quan nes Academy of Sciences quan quan miracle ict ac cn HuH an han hu ict ac cn Kevin Zhou kevin zhou gmail com Abstract Pseudo normality synthesis which computationally generates pseudo normal im age from an abnormal one with lesions is critical in many perspectives from lesion detection data augmentation to clinical surgery suggestion However it is chal leng ing to generate high quality pseudo normal images in the absence of the lesion in for mati on Thus expensive lesion segmentation data have been introduced to provide lesion information for the generative models and improve the quality of the synthetic images In this paper we aim to alleviate the need of large amount of lesion segmentation data when generating pseudo normal images We propose Semi supervised Medical Image generative LEarning network SMILE which not only utilizes limited medical images with segmentation masks but also leverages massive medical images without seg men ation masks to generate realistic pseudo normal images Spec ic ally our framework consists of four primary components including pseudo normality generator alesi on segment or conde ce enhancer and pseudo abnormality reconstructor We adopt the idea of adversarial training between the generator and the segment or and between there constructor and the segment or to produce realistic pseudo normal and pseudo abnormal images Furthermore to reduce the number of required lesion segmentation data we pro pose conde ce enhancer which maximizes the conde ce score of the segmentation prediction and enables our framework to learn in semi supervised learning To stabilize the model training step by step adversarial training scheme is also introduced Ex ten sive experiments show that our model outperforms the best state of the art model by up to for data augmentation task and in generating high quality images More over the proposed semi supervised learning achieves comparable medical image syn the is quality with supervised learning model using only of segmentation data The copyright of this document resides with its authors It maybe distributed unchanged freely in print or electronic forms

Generalization of Reinforcement Learning with Policy Aware Adversarial Data Augmentation Han ping Zhang Yu hong Guo Carleton University Ottawa Canada jag zhang mail carleton ca yu hong guo carleton ca Abstract The generalization gap in reinforcement learning RL has been sig ni cant obstacle that prevents the RL agent from learning general skills and adapt ing to varying environments Increasing the generalization capacity of the RL systems can sign cant ly improve their performance on real world working en vi ron ment In this work we propose novel policy aware adversarial data aug men ation method to augment the standard policy learning method with automatically generated trajectory data Different from the commonly used observation trans formation based data augmentations our proposed method adversarial ly generates new trajectory database don the policy gradient objective and aims to more ef fec iv ely increase the RL agents generalization ability with the policy aware data augmentation Moreover we further deploy mix up step to integrate the orig nal and generated data to enhance the generalization capacity while mitigating the over deviation of the adversarial data We conduct experiments on number of RL tasks to investigate the generalization performance of the proposed method by comparing it with the standard baselines and the state of the art mix reg approach The results show our method can generalize well with limited training diversity and achieve the state of the art generalization test performance Keywords Reinforcement Learning Generalization Policy Aware Adversarial Data Augmentation

Draft version July Typeset using LATEX two column style in AS TeX Constraining mornings evenings on distant worlds new semi analytical approach and prospects with transmission spectroscopy Nestor spinoza and Kathryn Jones Space Telescope Science Institute San Martin Drive Baltimore MD USA University of Bern Center for Space and Habitability Gesellschaft stra sse CH Bern Switzerland Received Revised Submitted to ABSTRACT The technique of transmission spectroscopy the variation of the planetary radius with wavelength due to opacity sources in the planets terminator region has been to date one of the most successful in the characterization of exoplanet atmospheres providing key insights into the composition and structure of these distant worlds common assumption made when using this technique however is that the variations are the same in the entire terminator region In reality the morning and evening terminators might have distinct temperature pressure and thus compositional roles due to the inherent nature of the planet which would in turn give rise to die rent spectra on each side of it Constraining those might be fundamental for our understanding of not only the weather patterns in these distant worlds but also of planetary formation signatures which might only be possible to extract once these features are well understood Motivated by this physical picture in this work we perform detailed study on the observational prospects of detecting this eec We present an open source semi analytical framework with which this information can be extracted directly from transit lightcurves and perform detailed study on the prospects of detecting the eec with current missions such as TESS and upcoming ones such as ST Our results show that these missions show great promise for the detection of this eec Transmission spectroscopy studies with ST in particular could provide spectra of each of the limbs allowing us to convey information previously accessible only via phase curves Keywords Exoplanet atmospheres Exoplanets Exoplanet astronomy

Tuning Mixed Input Hyper parameters on the Fly for Efc ent Population Based Auto RL Jack Parker Holder Vu Nguyen jack ph robots ox ac uk vu tng amazon com University of Oxford Amazon Shaan Desai Stephen Roberts shaan robots ox ac uk sj rob robots ox ac uk University of Oxford University of Oxford Abstract Despite series of recent successes in reinforcement learning RL many RL algorithms remain sensitive to hyper parameters As such there has recently been interest in the el of Auto RL which seeks to automate design decisions to create more general algorithms Recent work suggests that population based approaches maybe effective Auto RL algorithms by learning hyper parameter schedules on they In particular the PB algorithm is able to achieve strong performance in RL tasks by formulating online hyper parameter optimization as time varying GP band it problem while also providing theoretical guarantees However PB is only designed to work for continuous hyper parameters which severely limits its utility in practice In this paper we introduce new provably efc ent hierarchical approach for optimizing both continuous and categorical variables using new time varying band it algorithm spec ic ally designed for the population based training regime We evaluate our approach on the challenging Proc gen benchmark where we show that explicitly modelling dependence between data augmentation and other hyper parameters improves generalization

Re infection and low cross immunity as drivers of epidemic resurgence under high ero prevalence model based approach with application to Amazonas Brazil Edi lson Arruda Days Pastore Claudia Dias Fab rcio Ou rique Department of Decision Analytics and Risk Southampton Business School University of Southampton Building University Rd Hig held Southampton SO BJ UK Centro Federal de Edu cacao Tec no logic Celso Suck ow da Fonseca Av Maracan Rio de Janeiro RJ Brasil Graduate Program in Mathematical and Computational Modeling Multidisciplinary Institute Federal Rural University of Rio de Janeiro Av Gov Roberto Silveira Mo que ta Nova Igua cu RJ Brasil Department of Computation Federal University of Santa Catarina Campus Arar ngua Gov Jorge Lac erda Arar ngua SC Brasil Abstract This paper introduces new multi strain epidemic model with re infection and cross immunity to provide insights into the resurgence of the OVID epidemic in an area with reportedly high ero prevalence due to largely unmitigated outbreak the state of Amazonas Brazil Although high ero prevalence could have been expected to trigger herd immunity and pre vent further waves in the state we have observed persistent levels of infection after the rst wave and eventually the emergence of second viral strain just before an augmented second wave Our experiments suggest that the persistent levels of infection after the rst wave may be due to re infection whereas the higher peak at the second wave can be explained by the emergence of the second variant and low level of cross immunity between the original and the second variant Finally the proposed model provides insights into the eec of re infection and cross immunity on the long term spread of an unmitigated epidemic Keywords Epidemic modelling Multiple viral strains Re infection Corresponding author Email addresses arruda southampton ac uk Edi lson Arruda days pastore cef et rj br Days Pastore maz za claudia gmail com Claudia Dias Augmented Shortcuts for Vision Transformers Ye hui Tang Kai Han Chang Xu An Xiao Yi ping Deng Chao Xu Yun he Wang Key Lab of Machine Perception MOE Dept of Machine Intelligence Peking University Noah sArk Lab Hua wei Technologies Central Software Institution Hua wei Technologies School of Computer Science Faculty of Engineering University of Sydney tang pku edu cn kai han yun he wang an xiao yi ping deng hua wei com xu sydney edu au xu chao is pku edu cn Abstract Transformer models have achieved great progress on computer vision tasks re cent ly The rapid development of vision transformers is mainly contributed by their high representation ability for extracting informative features from input images However the mainstream transformer models are designed with deep arch it ec ture and the feature diversity will be continuously reduced as the depth increases feature collapse In this paper we theoretically analyze the feature collapse phenomenon and study the relationship between shortcuts and feature diversity in these transformer models Then we present an augmented shortcut scheme which inserts additional paths with learn able parameters in parallel on the original short cuts To save the computational costs we further explore an efc ent approach that uses the block irc ulan projection to implement augmented shortcuts Extensive experiments conducted on benchmark datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method which brings about accuracy increase of the state of the art visual transformers without obviously increasing their parameters and FLOPs
