MN RAS Pre print July Compiled using MN RAS LATEX style lev Machine learning galaxy properties from cm light cones impact of network architectures and signal contamination David Pre logo vi cid Andrei Me singer Steven Murray Giuseppe Fia men and Nicolas Gil let Scuola Normale Superiore Piazza dei Cavalieri Pisa Italy School of Earth and Space Exploration Arizona State University Terrace Mall Tempe AZ USA NVIDIA Technology Center Italy Via Melchior re Gioia Milan Italy Observatoire Astron omi que de Strasbourg Universit de Strasbourg rue de Universit Strasbourg France Accepted XXX Received YY in original form ZZZ ABSTRACT Imaging the cosmic cm signal will map out the rst billion years of our Universe The resulting light cone LC will encode the properties of the unseen rst galaxies and physical cosmology Unfortunately there is no obvious summary statistic to use when interpreting this non Gaussian image and the commonly used power spectrum may waste valuable information Here we build on previous work using Convolutional Neural Networks CNN to infer astrophysical parameters directly from cm LC images Guided by the properties of LCs we combine recurrent layers characterizing evolution along the redshift axis with convolutional layers characterizing local correlations in the sky plane Such Recursive Neural Networks RN Ns are known for cie ntl learning temporal correlations in sequential data Using large database of simulated cosmic cm LCs we con rm that RN Ns outperform previously used CNN in recovering UV and ray galaxy properties reducing the mean squared parameter estimation error by factors of We also corrupt the cosmic signal by adding noise expected from integration with the Square Kilometre Array as well as excising foreground contaminated horizon wedge Parameter prediction errors increase when the NN are trained on these contaminated LC images though recovery is still good even in the most pessimistic case with However we nd no notable dieren ces in performance between network architectures on the contaminated images We argue this is due to the size of our data set highlighting the need for larger datasets and or better data augmentation in order to maximize the potential of NN in cm parameter estimation Key words cosmology theory dark ages re ionization rst stars early Universe galaxies high redshift intergalactic medium methods data analysis

LDA Contrastive Learning for Semi Supervised Domain Adaptation An kit Singh Department of Computer Science IT Madras singh an kit se it ac in Abstract Unsupervised Domain Adaptation UDA aims to align the labeled sourced is tri but ion with the unlabeled target distribution to obtain domain invariant predictive models However the application of well known UDA approaches does not gene aliz ewell in Semi Supervised Domain Adaptation SSD scenarios where few labeled samples from the target domain are available In this paper we propose simple Contrastive Learning framework for semi supervised Domain Adaptation LDA that attempts to bridge the intra domain gap between the labeled and unlabeled target distributions and inter domain gap between source and unlabeled target distribution in SSD We suggest employing class wise contrastive learning to reduce the inter domain gap and instance level contrastive alignment between the original input image and strongly augmented unlabeled target images to mini miz the intra domain discrepancy We have shown empirically that both of these modules complement each other to achieve superior performance Experiments on three well known domain adaptation benchmark datasets namely Domain Net Ofce Home and Ofce demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach LDA achieves state of the art results on all the above datasets

When Cu ration Becomes Creation Algorithms Micro content and the Vanishing Distinction between Platforms and Creators Liu Le qi Dylan Had el Men ell Zachary Lipton le qi cs cmu edu hm sail mit edu lipton cmu edu July Ever since social activity on the Internet began migrating from the wilds of the open web to the walled gardens erected by so called platforms think Myspace Facebook Twitter YouTube or Tik Tok debates have raged about the responsibilities that these platforms ought to bear And yet despite intense scrutiny from the news media and grassroots movements of outraged users platforms continue to operate from legal standpoint on the friendliest terms You might say that todays platforms enjoy have your cake eat it too and here side of ice cream deal They simultaneously be net from broad discretion to organize and censor content however they choose powerful algorithms for cu rating practically limitless supply of user posted micro content according to whatever ends they wish and absolution from almost any liability associated with that content This favorable regulatory environment results from the current legal framework which is ingui she between intermediaries platforms and content providers This distinction is ill adapted to the modern social media landscape where platforms deploy powerful data driven algorithms so called to play an increasingly active role in shaping what people see and where users supply disconnected bits of raw content tweets photos etc as fodder Spec ic ally under Section of the Telecommunications Act of interactive com put er services are shielded from liability for information produced by information content providers While this provision was originally intended to protect telecommunications comp nie and Internet service providers from liability for content that merely passed through their plumbing the designation now shelters services such as Facebook Twitter and YouTube which actively shape user experiences Excepting obligations to take down spec ic categories of content child pornography and copyright violations todays platforms have license to monet ize whatever content they like moderate if and when it aligns with their corporate objectives and curate their content however they wish ANTECEDENTS IN MODERATION In his book Custodians of the Internet Tar let on Gillespie examines platforms through the lens of content moderation calling into focus an apparent contradiction Platforms con tant ly do and arguably must wade into the normative making political decisions about what content to allow and yet they operate absent responsibility on account of their purported neu tr ali ty Throughout Gillespie is even handed expressing sympathy for platforms predicament They must moderate and all mainstream platforms do Without moderation platforms are readily taken over by harass ers and robots and yet no moderation policy is value neutral Flash points in the moderation debates include years long protests over Facebook policy of classifying and later declassifying breastfeeding photographs as obscene content Face books controversial policy of taking down obscene but historically sign cant images such as

On the Convergence of Stochastic Extra gradient for Bi linear Games with Restarted Iteration Averaging Chris Jun chi Li cid cid Yao dong Yu cid cid Nicolas Loi zo Gauthier idel Yi Ma cid Nicolas Le Roux cid Michael Jordan cid University of California Berkeley cid Mila Universit de Montreal McGill University cid July Abstract We study the stochastic bi linear mini max optimization problem presenting an analysis of the Stochastic Extra Gradient SEG method with constant step size and presenting variations of the method that yield favorable convergence We rst note that the last iterate of the basic SEG method only contracts to ed neighborhood of the Nash equilibrium independent of the step size This contrasts sharply with the standard setting of minimization where standard stochastic algorithms converge to neighborhood that vanishes in proportion to the square root constant step size Under the same setting however we prove that when augmented with iteration averaging SEG provably converges to the Nash equilibrium and such rate is provably accelerated by incorporating scheduled restarting procedure In the interpolation setting we achieve an optimal convergence rate up to tight constants We present numerical experiments that validate our theoretical dings and demonstrate the eec ti ve ness of the SEG method when equipped with iteration averaging and restarting

Stabilizing Deep Learning with Con Nets and Vision Transformers under Data Augmentation Nicklas Hansen Ha oSu Xiao long Wang UC San Diego UC San Diego UC San Diego Abstract While agents trained by Reinforcement Learning RL can solve increasingly chal leng ing tasks directly from visual observations generalizing learned skills to novel environments remains very challenging Extensive use of data augmentation is promising technique for improving generalization in RL but it is often found to decrease sample efc ien cy and can even lead to divergence In this paper we investigate causes of instability when using data augmentation in common off policy RL algorithms We identify two problems both rooted in high variance targets Based on our dings we propose simple yet effective technique for stabilizing this class of algorithms under augmentation We perform extensive empirical evaluation of image based RL using both Con Nets and Vision Trans former ViT on family of benchmarks based on Deep Mind Control Suite as well as in robotic manipulation tasks Our method greatly improves stability and sample efc ien cy of Con Nets under augmentation and achieves generalization results competitive with state of the art methods for image based RL We further show that our method scales to RL with ViT based architectures and that data augmentation maybe especially important in this setting

Accepted in IEEE RS International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems ROS Cooperative Autonomous Vehicles that Sympathize with Human Drivers Be hrad oghi Rodolfo Valiente Do rsa Sadi gh Ram tin Pe dar sani Yas er allah Abstract Widespread adoption of autonomous vehicles will not become reality until solutions are developed that enable these intelligent agents to co exist with humans This includes safely and efc ent ly interacting with human driven vehicles especially in both conic ti ve and competitive scenarios We build up on the prior work on socially aware navigation and borrow the concept of social value orientation from psychology that formalizes how much importance person allocates to the welfare of others in order to induce altruistic behavior in autonomous driving In contrast with existing works that explicitly model the behavior of human drivers and rely on their expected response to create opportunities for cooperation our Sympathetic Cooperative Driving Sym Co Drive paradigm trains altruistic agents that realize safe and smooth raf cow in competitive driving scenarios only from experiential learning and without any explicit coordination We demonstrate sign cant improvement in both safety and tr afc level metrics Fig Seamless and safe highway merging requires all Vs as result of this altruistic behavior and importantly conclude working together and accounting for the human driven vehicles that the level of altruism in agents requires proper tuning as utility top Egoistic Vs solely optimize for their own utility agents that are too altruistic also lead to sub optimal tr afc bottom Altruistic Vs compromise on their welfare to account ow The code and supplementary material are available at for the human driven vehicles https sym co drive oghi net

Reinforcement Learning Provides Flexible Approach for Realistic Supply Chain Safety Stock Optimisation Edward El son Kos as iha Alexandra Brin tr up Institute for Manufacturing University of Cambridge United Kingdom Abstract Although safety stock optimisation has been studied for more than years most companies still use simplistic means to calculate necessary safety stock levels partly due to the mismatch between existing analytical methods emphases on deriving provably optimal solutions and companies preferences to sac rice optimal results in favour of more realistic problem settings newly emerging method from the el of Art ici al Intelligence namely Reinforcement Learning RL ers promise in ding optimal solutions while accommodating more realistic problem features Unlike analytical based models RL treats the problem as black box simulation environment mitigating against the problem of oversimplifying reality As such assumptions on stock keeping policy can be relaxed and higher number of problem variables can be accommodated While RL has been popular in other domains its applications in safety stock optimisation remain scarce In this paper we investigate three RL methods namely Learning Temporal Die rence Advantage Actor Critic and Multi agent Temporal Die rence Advantage Actor Critic for op timi sing safety stock in linear chain of independent agents Wend that RL can simultaneously opt mise both safety stock level and order quantity parameters of an inventory policy unlike classical safety stock optimisation models where only safety stock level is optimised while order quantity is predetermined based on simple rules This allows RL to model more complex supply chain procurement behaviour However RL takes longer time to arrive at solutions necessitating future research on identifying and improving trade os between the use of and mathematical models are needed Keywords Supply Chain Safety Stock Art ici al Intelligence Inventory Control Simulation Optimisation Reinforcement Learning

Cooperative Training and Latent Space Data Augmentation for Robust Medical Image Segmentation Chen Chen cid Kerstin Hammer nik Cheng Ou yang Chen Qin Wen jia Bai Daniel Ru eckert Bio MedIA Group Department of Computing Imperial College London UK Klin kum echt der Isar Technical University of Munich Germany Institute for Digital Communications University of Edinburgh UK Data Science Institute Imperial College London UK ul Department of Brain Sciences Imperial College London UK chen chen imperial ac uk Abstract Deep learning based segmentation methods are vulnerable to unforeseen data distribution shifts during deployment change of image appearances or contrasts caused by die rent scanners unexpected imaging artifacts etc In this paper we present cooperative framework for training image segmentation models and latent space augment tion method for generating hard examples Both contributions improve model generalization and robustness with limited data The cooper ti ve training framework consists of fast thinking network FT and slow thinking network ST TheFT learns decoupled image features and shape features for image reconstruction and segmentation tasks The ST learns shape priors for segmentation correction and rene ment The two networks are trained in cooperative manner The latent space aug ment ation generates challenging examples for training by masking the decoupled latent space in both channel wise and spatial wise manners We performed extensive experiments on public cardiac imaging datasets Using only subjects from single site for training we demonstrated improved cross site segmentation performance and increased robustness against various unforeseen imaging artifacts compared to strong baseline methods Particularly cooperative training with latent space data aug ment ation yields improvement in terms of average Dice score when compared to standard training method

Comparison of end to end neural network architectures and data augmentation methods for automatic infant motility assessment using wearable sensors Manu Air aks inen amps Van hat alo and Ok ko Rs nen Department of Signal Processing and Acoustics Aalto University Finland BABA center Pediatric Research Center Childrens Hospital Helsinki University Hospital and University of Helsinki Finland Unit of Computing Sciences Tampere University Finland Department of Clinical Neuro physiology HUS Medical Imaging Center University of Helsinki Helsinki University Hospital and University of Helsinki Finland Neuroscience Center University of Helsinki Helsinki Finland Abstract Infant motility assessment using intelligent wearable is promising new approach for as ses ment of infant neuro physiological development and where ec ent signal analysis plays central role This study investigates the use of die rent end to end neural network arch it ec ture for processing infant motility data from wearable sensors We focus on the performance and computational burden of alternative sensor encoder and time series modelling modules and their combinations In addition we explore the be nets of data augmentation methods in ideal and non ideal recording conditions The experiments are conducted using data set of multi sensor movement recordings from month old infants as captured by recently pro posed smart jumpsuit for infant motility assessment Our results indicate that the choice of the encoder module has major impact on classier performance For sensor encoders the best performance was obtained with parallel dimensional convolutions for intra sensor channel fusion with shared weights for all sensors The results also indicate that relatively com pact feature representation is obtainable for within sensor feature extraction without drastic loss to classier performance Comparison of time series models revealed that feed forward dilated convolutions with residual and skip connections outperformed all RN based models in performance training time and training stability The experiments also indicate that data augmentation improves model robustness in simulated packet loss or sensor dropout scenarios In particular signal and sensor dropout based augmentation strategies provided considerable boosts to performance without negatively aec ting the baseline performance Overall the re sul ts provide tangible suggestions on how to optimize end to end neural network training for multi channel movement sensor data

Learning De biased Representation via Disentangled Feature Augmentation Eung ye up Kim Jung soo Lee Ju young Lee Ji hyeon Lee Jaeg ul Choo KAIST Ka kao Enterprise South Korea ey kim be be to gina choo kaist ac kr josh ey michael jy ka kao enterprise com Abstract Imageclass cation models tend to make decisions based on peripheral attributes of data items that have strong correlation with target variable data set bias These biased models suffer from the poor generalization capability when eva lu ate don unbiased datasets Existing approaches for de biasing often identify and emphasize those samples with no such correlation bias conic ting without de ning the bias type in advance However such bias conic ting samples are sign cant ly scarce in biased datasets limiting the de biasing capability of these approaches This paper rst presents an empirical analysis revealing that training with diverse bias conic ting samples beyond given training set is crucial for de biasing as well as the generalization capability Based on this observation we propose novel feature level data augmentation technique in order to synthesize diverse bias conic ting samples To this end our method learns the disentangled representation of the intrinsic attributes those inherently de ning certain class and bias attributes peripheral attributes causing the bias from large number of bias aligned samples the bias attributes of which have strong correlation with the target variable Using the disentangled representation we synthesize bias conic ting samples that contain the diverse intrinsic attributes of bias aligned samples by swapping their latent features By utilizing these divers ed bias conic ting features during the training our approach achieves superior classic ation accuracy and de biasing results against the existing baselines on both synthetic as well as real world datasets

Real vs Simulated Fovea ted Rendering to Reduce Visual Discomfort in Virtual Reality Ariel Caput Andrea Gia chet ti alwa Ab kal Chiara Marches in and Massimo Zan can aro University of Verona Department of Computer Science University of Trento Department of Psychology and Cognitive Science Fond azione Bruno Kessler pre print version please cite as Caput Gia chet tiA Ab kal Marches in iC Zan can roM Real vs Simulated Fovea ted Rendering to Reduce Visual Discomfort in Vi tu al Reality In Proceedings of the th Intern ional Conference promoted by the IF IP Technical Committee on Human Computer Interaction INTERACT August th September rd Bari Italy Abstract In this paper study aimed at investigating the eec ts of real using eye tracking to determine the ation and simulated fovea ted blurring in mmer sive Virtual Reality is presented Techniques to reduce the optical ow perceived at the visual el margins are often employed in mmer sive Virtual Reality environments to alleviate discomfort exp rien ced when the visual motion perception does not correspond to the body acceleration Although still preliminary our results suggest that for participants with higher self declared sensitivity to sickness there might be an improvement for nausea when using blurring The per ce ved di cult of the task seems to improve when the real fovea ted method is used Keywords Virtual Reality Motion Sickness Fovea ted rendering

Bag of Instances Aggregation Boosts Self supervised Learning Hao hang Xu Jie min Fang Xiao peng Zhang Ling xiX ie Xing gang Wang Wen rui Dai Hong kai Xiong Qi Tian Shanghai Jiao Tong University Hua wei Inc Institute of Art ici al Intelligence Hua zhong University of Science Technology School of EI Hua zhong University of Science Technology xu hao hang dai wen rui xiong hong kai sj tu edu cn jam in fong gwang hust edu cn zx history xc gmail com tian qi hua wei com Abstract Recent advances in self supervised learning have experienced remarkable progress especially for contrastive learning based methods which regard each image as well as its augmentations as an individual class and try to distinguish them from all other images However due to the large quantity of exemplars this kind of pretext task intrinsically suffers from slow convergence and is hard for optimization This is especially true for small scale models which wend the performance drops drama ic ally comparing with its supervised counterpart In this paper we propose simple but effective distillation strategy for unsupervised learning The highlight is that the relationship among similar samples counts and can be seamlessly transferred to the student to boost the performance Our method termed as BINGO which is short for Bag of InstaNces aGgregatiOn targets at transferring the relationship learned by the teacher to the student Here bag of instances indicates set of similar samples constructed by the teacher and are grouped within bag and the goal of distillation is to aggregate compact representations over the student with respect to instances in bag Notably BINGO achieves new state of the art performance on small scale models and top ac curacies with linear evaluation on Image Net using Res Net andRes Net as backbone respectively surpass ing baselines and top ac curacies by sign cant margin The code will be avail abel at https it hub com hao hang bingo

Online and Of in Robot Programming via Augmented Reality Work spaces Yong Joon Th oo Jeremy Macei ras Philip Abbe Matt Racc Hakan Gir in and Sylvain Cal in on Abstract Robot programming methods for industrial robots are time consuming and often require operators to have knowl edge in robotics and programming To reduce costs associated with reprogramming various interfaces using augmented reality have recently been proposed to provide users with more intuitive means of controlling robots in real time and programming them without having to code However most solutions require the operator to be close to the real robots work space which implies either removing it from the production line or shutting down the whole production line due to safety hazards We propose novel augmented reality interface providing the users with the ability to model virtual representation of work space which can be saved and reused to program new tasks or adapt old ones without having to be co located with the real robot Similar to previous interfaces the operators then have the ability to program robot tasks or control the robot in real time by manipulating virtual robot We evaluate the intuitive ness and usability of the proposed interface with user study where participants programmed robot manipulator for is assembly task

Physical Sciences University of Adelaide University of Adelaide Adelaide South Australia Adelaide South Australia michael douglass adelaide edu au July ABSTRACT Radiation therapy requires clinical linear accelerators to be mechanically and dos metrically calibrated to high standard One important quality assurance testis the Winston Lutz test which localizes the radiation iso centre of the lina In the current work we demonstrate novel method of analysing EPI based Winston Lutz QA images using deep learning model trained only on synthetic image data In addition we propose novel method of generating the synthetic images and associated ground truth masks using an optical ray tracing engine to fake mega voltage EPI images The model called Deep was trained on synthetic images using data augmentation techniques for epochs The model was built using Ker as with Tensor Flow backend on an Intel Core CPU and trained in approximately hours Deep was shown to produce ball bearing and multi leaf colli mato rel segmentation with mean dice coe fci ent of and respectively on previously unseen synthetic testing data When Deep was applied oWL data measured on an EPI the predicted mean displacements were shown to be statistically similar to the Canny Edge detection method However the Deep predictions for the ball bearing locations were shown to correlate better with manual annotations compared with the Canny edge detection algorithm Deep was demonstrated to analyse Winston Lutz images with accuracy suitable for routine lina quality assurance with some statistical evidence that it may outperform Canny Edge detection methods in terms of segmentation robustness and the resultant displacement predictions Keywords deep learning radiation oncology quality assurance linear accelerator synthetic data Blender Machine Learning Medical Physics optical path tracing

Economic Dispatch of an Integrated Micro grid Based on the Dynamic Process of CCG Plant Zhi iL in Chun yue Song Jun Zhao Chao Yang Hu anY in College of Control Science and Engineering Zhejiang University Hangzhou mail song zju edu cn Abstract Intra day economic dispatch of an integrated micro grid is fundamental requirement to integrate distributed generators The dynamic energy ow in cogeneration units present challenges to the energy management of the micro grid In this paper novel approximate dynamic programming ADP approach is proposed to solve this problem based on value function approximation which is distinct with the consideration of the dynamic process constraints of the combined cycle gas turbine CCG plant First we mathematically formulate the multi time periods decision problem as nite horizon Markov decision process To deal with the thermodynamic process an augmented state vector of CCG is introduced Second the proposed VF ADP algorithm is employed to derive the near optimal real time operation strategies In addition to guarantee the monotonic it of piecewise linear function we apply the SPAR algorithm in the update process To validate the effectiveness of the proposed method we conduct experiments with comparisons to some traditional optimization methods The results indicate that our proposed ADP method achieves better performance on the economic dispatch of the micro grid KeyWords Micro grid Dynamic Process Combined Cycle Gas Turbine Approximate Dynamic Programming

Growing Urban Bicycle Networks Michael Szell Say at Mi marc Tyler Perlman Gou rab Ghosh alc and Roberta Sinatra NEtwoRks Data and Society NERDS IT University of Copenhagen Copenhagen Denmark Complexity Science Hub Vienna Vienna Austria Department of Physics and Astronomy University of Rochester Rochester NY USA Abstract Cycling is promising solution to unsustainable car centric urban transport systems However prevailing bicycle network development follows slow and piecewise process without taking into account the structural complexity of transportation networks Here we explore systematically the topological limitations of urban bicycle network development For cities we study die rent variations of growing synthetic bicycle network between an arbitrary set of points routed on the urban street network Wend initially decreasing returns on investment until critical threshold posing fundamental consequences to sustainable urban planning Cities must invest into bicycle networks with the right growth strategy and persistently to surpass critical mass We also nd pronounced overlaps of synthetically grown networks in cities with well developed existing bicycle net works showing that our model re ect reality Growing networks from scratch makes our approach generally applicable starting point for sustainable urban bicycle network planning with minimal data requirements

Integrating Circle Kernels into Convolutional Neural Networks Kun He Chao Li Yi xiao Yang School of Computer Science and Technology Hua zhong University of Science and Technology Wuhan brook let hust edu cn Gao Huang Department of Automation Tsinghua University Beijing gao huang tsinghua edu cn John Hop croft Computer Science Department Cornell University Ithaca USA eh cs cornell edu Abstract The square kernel is standard unit for contemporary Convolutional Neural Net works CNN as it ts well on the tensor computation for the convolution opera tion However the receptive ldin the human visual system is actually isotropic like circle Motivated by this observation we propose using circle kernels with isotropic receptive lds for the convolution and our training takes approximately equivalent amount of calculation when compared with the corresponding CNN with square kernels Our preliminary experiments demonstrate the rationality of circle kernels We then propose kernel boosting strategy that integrates the circle kernels with square kernels for the training and inference and we further let the kernel size radius be learn able during the training Note that were parameter ize the circle kernels or integrated kernels before the inference thus taking no extra computation as well as the number of parameter overhead for the testing Extensive experiments on several standard datasets Image Net CI FAR and CI FAR using the circle kernels or integrated kernels on typical existing CNN show that our approach exhibits highly competitive performance Spec ic ally on Image Net with standard data augmentation our approach dramatically boosts the performance of Mobile Ne tV Small by top accuracy and top accuracy and boosts the performance of Mobile Ne tV Large by top accuracy and top accuracy The rst three authors contribute equally Corresponding author Corresponding author Pre print Under review

EVA RS GP EVent triggered Augmented Refitting of Gaussian Process Regression for Seasonal Data Florian Has el beck and Dominik Grimm Technical University of Munich TUM Campus Straubing for Biotechnology and Sustainability Bioinformatics chul gas se Straubing Germany Wei hen stephan Tries dorf University of Applied Sciences Bioinformatics Peters gas se Straubing Germany Technical University of Munich Department of Informatics Bolt manns tr Garching Germany florian has el beck dominik grimm hs wt de Abstract Time series forecasting is growing domain with diverse applications However changes of the system behavior over time due to internal or external influences are challenging Therefore predictions of previously learned fore casting model might not be useful anymore In this paper we present EVent triggered Augmented Refitting of Gaussian Process Regression for Seasonal Data EVA RS GP novel online algorithm that is able to handle sudden shifts in the target variable scale of seasonal data For this purpose EVA RS GP com bin es online change point detection with refitting of the prediction model using data augmentation for samples prior to change point Our experiments on sim late data show that EVA RS GP is applicable for wide range of output scale changes EVA RS GP has on average lower RMS on different real world datasets compared to methods with similar computational resource con sump tion Furthermore we show that our algorithm leads to six fold reduction of the averaged runtime in relation to all comparison partners with periodical refitting strategy In summary we present computationally efficient online fore casting algorithm for seasonal time series with changes of the target variable scale and demonstrate its functionality on simulated as well as real world data All code is publicly available on it Hub https it hub com grimm lab eva rs gp Keywords Gaussian Process Regression Seasonal Time Series Change Point Detection Online Time Series Forecasting Data Augmentation

Relational Quantum Mechanics and the BR Theorem Peaceful Coexistence Andrea Old of redi Claudio Calo si July Abstract According to Relational Quantum Mechanics QM the wave function is considered neither concrete physical item evolving in spacetime nor an object representing the absolute state of certain quantum system In this interpretative framework is de ned as computational device encoding observers in form tion hence QM ers somewhat epistemic view of the wave function This perspective seems to be at odds with the BR theorem formal result excluding that wavefunctions represent knowledge of an underlying reality described by some on tic state In this paper we argue that QM is not aec ted by the conclusions of PB Rs argument consequently the alleged inconsistency can be dissolved To do that we will thoroughly discuss the very foundations of the BR theorem Harri gan and pek kens categorization of ontological models showing that their implicit assumptions about the nature of the on tic state are incompatible with the main tenets of QM Then we will ask whether it is possible to derive relational BR type result answering in the negative This conclusion shows some limitations of this theorem not yet discussed in the literature Keywords Relational Quantum Mechanics BR Theorem On tic States Epistemic States Accepted for publication in Foundations of Physics Contact Information Universit de Lausanne Section de Philosophie Lausanne Switzerland mail Andrea Old of redi nil ch Contact Information Universit de Geneve Section de Philosophie Geneve Switzerland mail Claudio Calo si uni ge ch

Quantum Annealing Formulation for Binary Neural Networks Michele as dell Tat Jun Chin School of Computer Science The University of Adelaide Adelaide Australia michele as dell tat jun chin adelaide edu au Abstract Quantum annealing is promising paradigm for building practical quantum com put ers Compared to other approaches quantum annealing technology has been scaled up to larger number of qu bits On the other hand deep learning has been profoundly successful in pushing the boundaries of It is thus natural to investigate potentially game changing technologies such as quantum anneal ers to augment the capabilities of deep learning In this work we explore binary neural networks which are lightweight yet powerful models typically intended for resource constrained devices Departing from current training regimes for binary networks that smooth approximate the activation functions to make the network differentiable we devise quadratic un constrained binary optimization formulation for the training problem While the problem is intractable the cost to estimate the binary weights scales exponentially with network size we show how the problem can be optimized directly on quantum anneal er there by opening up to the potential gains of quantum computing We experimentally validated our formulation via simulation and testing on an actual quantum anneal er Wave Advantage the latter to the extent allowable by the capacity of current technology

in developing countries with potentially far reaching consequences We conduct randomized experiment in urban Pakistan to evaluate the eec ti ve ness of two educational interventions to counter misinformation among low digital literacy populations We do not nd sign cant eec of video based general educational messages about misinformation However when such messages are augmented with personalized feedback based on individuals past engagement with fake news we nd an improvement of standard deviations in identifying fake news We also nd negative but in sign cant eec ts on identifying true news driven by female respondents Our results suggest that educational interventions can enable information discernment but their eec ti ve ness critically depends on how well their features and delivery are customized for the population of interest Ali Department of Economics Lahore University of Management Sciences LU MS DHA Lahore Can tt Lahore Pakistan ayesha ali lu ms edu pk United Kingdom ul Nara Institute of Science and Technology Division of Information Science Nara Japan Augusta University School of Computer and Cyber Sciences Augusta Georgia United States of America Correspondence Corresponding Author email uni edu ABSTRACT In recent years everyday activities such as work and socialization have steadily shifted to more remote and virtual settings With the OVID pandemic the switch from physical to virtual has been accelerated which has substantially affected various aspects of our lives including business education commerce healthcare and personal life This rapid and large scale switch from in person to remote interactions has revealed that our current technologies lack functionality and are limited in their ability to recreate interpersonal interactions To help address these limitations in the future we introduce Tele life vision for the near future that depicts the potential means to improve remote living better aligned with how we interact live and work in the physical world Tele life encompasses novel syne gies of technologies and concepts such as digital twins virtual prototyping and attention and context aware user interfaces with innovative hardware that can support ultra realistic graphics user state detection and more These ideas will guide the transformation of our daily lives and routines soon targeting the year In addition we identify opportunities across high impact applications in domains related to this vision of Tele life Along with recent survey of relevant lds such as human computer interaction pervasive computing and virtual reality the directions outlined in this paper will guide future research on remote living Keywords Tele life Tele presence Tele work Remote Living Digital transformation

Exact Learning Augmented Naive Bayes Class fier Exact Learning Augmented Naive Bayes Classier Shout Suga hara suga hara lab ec ac jp Graduate school of Informatics and Engineering The University of Electro Communications Cho fuga oka Ch of shi Tokyo Japan Mao mi Ueno ueno lab ec ac jp Graduate school of Informatics and Engineering The University of Electro Communications Cho fuga oka Ch of shi Tokyo Japan Editor Abstract Earlier studies have shown that classic ation ac curacies of Bayesian networks BN ob tai ned by maximizing the conditional log likelihood LL of class variable given the feature variables were higher than those obtained by maximizing the marginal likelihood ML However dieren ces between the performances of the two scores in the earlier stud ies may be attributed to the fact that they used approximate learning algorithms not exact ones This paper compares the classic ation ac curacies of BN with approximate learning using LL to those with exact learning using ML The results demonstrate that the classic ation ac curacies of BN obtained by maximizing the ML are higher than those obtained by maximizing the LL for large data However the results also demonstrate that the classic ation ac curacies of exact learning BN using the ML are much worse than those of other methods when the sample size is small and the class variable has numerous parents To resolve the problem we propose an exact learning augmented naive Bayes classier AN which ensures class variable with no parents The proposed method is guaranteed to asymptotically estimate the identical class posterior to that of the ex act ly learned BN Comparison experiments demonstrated the superior performance of the proposed method Keywords Augmented naive Bayes classier Bayesian networks classic ation structure learning

JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL NO AUGUST CF Simple Framework for ELF Self supervised Collaborative Filtering in Zhou Aix in Sun Yong Liu Jie Zhang and Chun yan Miao Abstract Collaborative lte ring CF is widely used to learn an informative latent representation of user or item from observed interactions Existing CF based methods commonly adopt negative sampling to discriminate different items That is observed user item pairs are treated as positive instances unobserved pairs are considered as negative instances and are sampled under de ned distribution for training Training with negative sampling on large datasets is computationally expensive Further negative items should be carefully sampled under the de ned distribution in order to avoid selecting an observed positive item in the training data set Unavoidably some negative items sampled from the training data set could be positive in the test set Recently self supervised learning SSL has emerged as powerful tool to learn model without negative samples In this paper we propose self supervised collaborative lte ring framework SELF CF that is specially designed for recommend er scenario with implicit feedback The proposed SELF CF frameworks implies the Siamese networks and can be easily applied to existing deep learning based CF models which we refer to as backbone networks The main idea of SELF CF is to augment the output embedding generated by backbone networks because it is infeasible to augment raw input of user itemid We propose and study three output perturbation techniques that can be applied to different types of backbone networks including both traditional CF models and graph based models The framework enables ul learning informative representations of users and items without negative samples and is agnostic to the encapsulated backbones By encapsulating two popular recommendation models into the framework our experiments on three datasets show that the best performance of our framework is comparable or better than the supervised counterpart We also show that SELF CF can boost up the performance by up to on average compared with another self supervised framework as the baseline Source codes are available at https it hub com enoch Self CF Index Terms Collaborative Filtering Self supervised Learning Recommend er Systems Siamese Networks cid

Under consideration for publication in Fluid Me ch On the enhancement of boundary layer skin friction by turbulence an angular momentum approach Ahmed lnah has Perry Johnson Center for Turbulence Research Stanford University Stanford CA USA Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering University of California Irvine CA USA Received xx revised xx accepted xx Turbulence enhances the wall shear stress in boundary layers sign cant ly increasing the drag on streamlined bodies Other ow features such as free stream pressure gradients and stream wise boundary layer growth also strongly in en ce the skin friction In this paper an angular momentum integral AMI equation is introduced to quantify the see ect by representing them as torques that alter the shape of the mean velocity role This approach uniquely isolates the skin friction of Blas ius boundary layer in single term that depends only on the Reynolds number so that other torques are interpreted as augmentations relative to the laminar case having the same Reynolds number The AMI equation for external ow shares this key property with the so called FI relation for internal ow uk agata et al Ph ys Fluids Without geometrically imposed boundary layer thickness the length scale in the Reynolds number for the AMI equation maybe chosen freely After brief demonstration using Falkner Sk an boundary layers the AMI equation is applied as diagnostic tool on four transitional and turbulent boundary layer DNS datasets Regions of negative wall normal velocity are shown to play key role in limiting the peak skin friction during the late stages of transition and the relative strengths of terms in the AMI equation become independent of the transition mechanism very short distance into the fully turbulent regime The AMI equation establishes an intuitive extensible framework for interpreting the impact of turbulence and ow control strategies on boundary layer skin friction

Framework of High Stakes Algorithmic Decision Making for the Public Sector Developed through Case Study of Child Welfare DEVAN SH XENA Marquette University USA KARL BAD ILL UR QUI OLA University of Central Florida USA PAMELA WISNIEWSKI University of Central Florida USA SHI ON GU HA University of Toronto Canada Algorithms have permeated throughout civil government and society where they are being used to make high stakes decisions about human lives In this paper we first develop cohesive framework of algorithmic decision making adapted for the public sector AD MAPS that reflects the complex socio technical interactions between human discretion bureaucratic processes and algorithmic decision making by synthesizing disparate bodies of work in the fields of Human Computer Interaction HC Science and Technology Studies STS and Public Administration PA We then applied the AD MAPS framework to conduct qualitative analysis of an in depth eight month ethnographic case study of the algorithms in daily use within child welfare agency that serves approximately families and children in the mid western United States Overall we found there is need to focus on strength based algorithmic outcomes centered in social ecological frameworks In addition algorithmic systems need to support existing bureaucratic processes and augment human discretion rather than replace it Finally collective buy in in algorithmic systems requires trust in the target outcomes at both the practitioner and bureaucratic levels As result of our study we propose guidelines for the design of high stakes algorithmic decision making tools in the child welfare system and more generally in the public sector We empirically validate the theoretically derived AD MAPS framework to demonstrate how it can be useful for systematically making pragmatic decisions about the design of algorithms for the public sector CCS Concepts Human centered computing Human computer interaction HC Empirical studies in HC Applied computing Computing in government Additional KeyWords and Phrases algorithmic decision making discretion bureaucracy child welfare system ACM Reference Format Devan sh xena Karl Bad ill Ur qui ola Pamela Wisniewski and Shi on Gu ha Framework of High Stakes Algorithmic Decision Making for the Public Sector Developed through Case Study of Child Welfare July pages https doi org Adaptive Stress Testing for Adversarial Learning in Financial Environment Khalid El Awad July Abstract We demonstrate the use of Adaptive Stress Testing to detect and address potential vu lner bil ties in nanci al environment We develop as implied model for credit card fraud detection that utilizes linear regression classier based on historical payment transaction data coupled with business rules We then apply the reinforcement learning model known as Adaptive Stress Testing to train an agent that can be thought of as potential fraud ster to nd the most likely path to system failure successfully defrauding the system We show the connection between this most likely failure path and the limits of the classier and discuss how the fraud detection systems business rules can be further augmented to mitigate these failure modes

This draft was prepared using the LaTeX style le belonging to the Journal of Fluid Mechanics Modeling silo clogging with non local granular he ology achi th Duna tung and Ken Ka mr in MIT Department of Mechanical Engineering Massachusetts Ave Cambridge MA Received xx revised xx accepted xx Granula row in silo demonstrates multiple non local heo logical phenomena due to the nite size of grains We solve the Non local Granular Fluidity NGF continuum model in quasi silo geometries and evaluate its ability to predict these non local eec ts including ow spreading and importantly clogging arrest when the opening is small enough The model is augmented to include free separation criterion and is implemented numerically with an extension of the trans phase granular ow solver described in Duna tung Ka mr in to produce full el solutions The implementation is validated against analytical results of the model in the inclined chute geometry such as the solution for the curve for size dependent ow arrest and the velocity role stop as function of layer height We then implement the model in the silo geometry and vary the apparent grain size The model predicts jamming criterion when the opening competes with the scale of the mean grain size which agrees with previous experimental studies marking the rst time to our knowledge that silo jamming has been achieved with continuum model For larger openings the ow within the silo obtains diu sive characteristic whose spread depends on the models non local amplitude and the mean grain size The numerical tests are controlled for grid eec ts and comparison study of coarse vs re ned numerical simulations shows agreement in the pressure el the shape of the arch in jammed silo cong ration and the velocity el in owing cong ration

hybrid virtual sensing approach for approximating non linear dynamic system behavior using STM networks He in dela Hants ch kea Kastner Technische Universitat Dresden Institute of Solid Mechanics Dresden Germany Dresden Center for Fatigue and Reliability CFR Dresden Germany Abstract Modern Internet of Things solutions are used in variety of die rent areas ranging from connected vehicles and healthcare to industrial applications They rely on large amount of interconnected sensors which can lead to both technical and economical challenges Virtual sensing techniques aim to reduce the number of physical sensors in system by using data from available measurements to estimate additional unknown quantities of interest Successful model based solutions include Kal man lter or the combination of nite element models and modal analysis while many data driven methods rely on machine learning algorithms The presented hybrid virtual sensing approach combines Long Short Term Memory networks with frequency response function models in order to estimate the behavior of non linear dynamic systems with multiple input and output channels Network training and prediction make use of short signal sub sequences which are later recombined by applying windowing technique The frequency response function model acts as baseline estimate which perfectly captures linear dynamic systems and is augmented by the non linear Long Short Term Memory network following two die rent hybrid modeling strategies The approach is tested using an on linear experimental data set which results from measurements of three component servo hydraulic fatigue test bench variety of metrics in time and frequency domains as well as fatigue strength under variable amplitudes are used to evaluate the approximation quality of the proposed method In addition to virtual sensing the algorithm is also applied to forward prediction task Synthetic data are used in separate study to estimate the prediction quality on datasets of die rent size Keywords virtual sensing STM non linear dynamic systems hybrid modeling forward prediction

Augmented Data as an Auxiliary Plug in Towards Categorization of Crowd sourced Heritage Data Shashi har Veer appa Ku dari Aks hay kumar Gun ari Adarsh Jama dandi Ramesh Ashok Tabi and Uma Mud ena gud KLE Technological University Hub ball shashi dha rv gmail com aks hay gun ari gmail com adarsh to tweak labs inc com ramesh kle tech ac in uma kle tech ac in Abstract In this paper we propose strategy to mitigate the pro lem of in ec ent clustering performance by introducing data aug men ation as an auxiliary plug in Classical clustering techniques such as means Gaussian mixture model and spectral clustering are central to many data driven applications However recently unsupervised si mult neo us feature learning and clustering using neural networks also known as Deep Embedded Clustering DEC has gained prominence Pioneering works on deep feature clustering focus on de ning relevant clustering loss function and choosing the right neural network for extracting features central problem in all these cases is data sparsity accompanied by high intra class and low inter class variance which subsequently leads to poor clustering performance and erroneous candidate assignments Towards this we employ data augmentation techniques to improve the density of the clusters thus improving the overall performance We train variant of Convolutional Auto encoder CAE with augmented data to construct the initial feature space as novel model for deep clustering We demonstrate the results of proposed strategy on crowd sourced Indian Heritage data set Extensive experiments show consistent improvements over existing works Keywords Data Augmentation Convolutional Auto encoders Uns per vised Learning Categorization Clustering

Moment based density and risk estimation from grouped summary statistics PHILIPPE LAMBERT Institut de Recherche en Sciences Social es RSS Method es Quantitative en Sciences Social es Universit de Li ge Place des Orate urs Li ge Belgium Email lambert liege be Institut de Statist que Bio statist que et Sciences Act ariel les IS BA Universit catholique de Louvain oie du Roman Pays Louvain la Neuve Belgium July Abstract Data on continuous variable are often summarized by means of histograms or displayed in tabular format the range of data is partitioned into consecutive interval classes and the number of observations falling within each class is provided to the analyst Computations can then be carried in non parametric way by assuming uniform distribution of the variable within each partitioning class by concentrating all the observed values in the center or by spreading them to the extremities Smoothing methods can also be applied to estimate the underlying density or parametric model can be ted to these grouped data For insurance loss data some additional information is often provided about the observed values contained in each class typically class spec ic sample moments such as the mean the variance or even the skew ness and the kurt os is The question is then how to include this additional information in the estimation procedure The present paper proposes method for performing density and quan tile estimation based on such augmented information with an illustration on car insurance data Keywords Non parametric density estimation grouped data sample moments risk measures

Federated Learning for Multi Center Imaging Diagnostics Study in Cardiovascular Disease Ak is Lina dos Kai sar Kush bar Sean Walsh Poly xen kon tra and Karim Lek dir University of Barcelona Department of Mathematics and Computer Science Barcelona Spain Radio mic Liege Belgium lina dos ak is ub edu ABSTRACT Deep learning models can enable accurate and efc ent disease diagnosis but have thus far been hampered by the data scarcity present in the medical world Automated diagnosis studies have been constrained by underpowered single center datasets and although some results have shown promise their general iz ability to other institutions remains questionable as the data heterogeneity between institutions is not taken into account By allowing models to be trained in distributed manner that preserves patients privacy federated learning promises to alleviate these issues by enabling diligent multi center studies We present the rst federated learning study on the modality of cardiovascular magnetic resonance MR and use four centers derived from subsets of the and CDC datasets focusing on the diagnosis of hyper troph ic cardiomyopathy CM We adapt CNN network pre trained on action recognition and explore two different ways of incorporating shape prior information to the model and four different data augmentation set ups systematically analyzing their impact on the different collaborative learning choices We show that despite the small size of data subjects derived from four centers the privacy preserving federated learning achieves promising results that are competitive with traditional centralized learning We further nd that federative ly trained models exhibit increased robustness and are more sensitive to domain shift effects

Remote Working Pre and Post OVID An Analysis of New Threats and Risks to Security and Privacy Jason Nurse Nikki Williams Emily Collins Niki Pant eli John Blythe and Ben Kopp elm an University of Kent UK Nurse kent ac uk Crane ld University UK Card University UK Royal Holloway University of London UK Cy Safe London UK Cyber Smart London UK Abstract OVID has radically changed society as we know it To reduce the spread of the virus millions across the globe have been forced to work remotely often in make shift home ces and using plethora of new unfamiliar digital technologies In this article we critically anal se cyber security and privacy concerns arising due to remote working during the coronavirus pandemic Through our work we discover se ries of security risks emerging because of the realities of this period For instance lack of remote working security training heightened stress and anxiety rushed technology deployment and the presence of un trusted individuals in remote working environment in at shares can result in new cyber risk Simultaneously we nd that as organisations look to manage these and other risks posed by their remote work forces employees privacy including personal information and activities is of ten compromised This is apparent in the sign cant adoption of remote workplace monitoring management and surveillance technologies Such technologies raise several privacy and ethical questions and further high light the tension between security and privacy going forward Keywords Remote working Working from home Coronavirus Cy ber security Privacy Human Factors Workplace surveillance Ethics Human Computer Interaction This is the author version of the article Nurse Williams Collins Pant eli Blythe Kopp elm an Remote Working Pre and Post OVID An Analysis of New Threats and Risks to Security and Privacy In Stephan id is Anton to eds HC International HC II Communications in Computer and Information Science vol Springer Cham https doi org

Federated Semi Supervised Learning Approach for Network Traffic Classification Yao Peng Mei rong He Yu Wang Institute of Artificial Intelligence and Block chain Guangzhou University China yu wang zhu edu cn Abstract Network traffic classification task to classify network traffic and identify its type is the most fundamental step to improve network services and manage modern networks Classical machine learning and deep learning method have developed well in the field of network traffic classification However there are still two major challenges One is how to protect the privacy of users traffic data and the other is that it is difficult to obtain labeled data in reality In this paper we propose novel approach using federated semi supervised learning for network traffic classification In our approach the federated servers and several clients work together to train global classification model Among them unlabeled data is used on the client and labeled data is used on the server Moreover we use two traffic sub flow sampling methods simple sampling and incremental sampling for data preprocessing The experimental results in the QUI data set show that the accuracy of our federated semi supervised approach can reach and when using the simple sampling method and incremental sampling method respectively The experimental results also show that the accuracy gap between our method and the centralized training method is minimal and it can effectively protect users privacy and does not require large amount of labeled data Keywords Network Traffic Class fier Federated Semi supervised Learning Privacy Security Packet Sampling

PRE PRINT Multi level Stress Assessment from ECG in Virtual Reality Environment using Multi modal Fusion Zeeshan Ahmad Member IEEE uh Rabb ani Member IEEE Muhammad Rehman Za far Member IEEE Sy em Isha que Member IEEE ridha Krishna Senior Member IEEE and Nai mul Khan Senior Member IEEE Abstract ECG is an attractive option to assess stress in serious Virtual Reality VR applications due to its non invasive nature However the existing Machine Learning ML models perform poorly Moreover existing studies only perform binary stress assessment while to develop more engaging biofeedback based application multi level assessment is necessary Existing studies annotate and classify single experience watching VR video to single stress level which again prevents design of dynamic experiences where real time in game stress assessment can be utilized In this paper we report our findings on new study on VR stress assessment where three stress levels are assessed ECG data was collected from users experiencing VR roller coaster The VR experience was then manually labeled in seconds segments to three stress levels by three rate rs We then propose novel multi modal deep fusion model utilizing spec tr ogram and ECG that can provide stress prediction from just second window Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed model outperforms the classical HR based ML models increase in accuracy and baseline deep learning models increase in accuracy We also report results on the benchmark WE SAD data set to show the supremacy of the model Index Terms Stress Virtual Reality ECG biofeedback serious games multi modal fusion deep learning

Approximation algorithms for the directed path partition problems Yong Chen Zhi Zhong Chen Curtis Kennedy Guo hui Lin Yao Xu An Zhang July Abstract Given directed graph the path partition problem is to nd minimum collection of vertex disjoint directed paths each of order at most to coverall the vertices of The problem has various applications in facility location network monitoring transportation and others Its special case on un directed graphs has received much attention recently but the general directed version is seemingly untouched in the literature We present the rst approximation algorithm for any based on novel concept of augmenting path to minimize the number of singletons in the partition When we present an improved approximation algorithm based on the maximum path cycle cover followed by careful cycle elimination process When we de ne the second novel kind of augmenting paths and propose an improved approximation algorithm Keywords Path partition directed graph augmenting path matching path cycle cover approximation algorithm Acknowledgements This research is supported by theN FC Grants and Can dAZ the Zhejiang Provincial NSF Grant LY and AZ the CSC Grants and AZ the Grant in Aid for Sci en tic Research of the Ministry of Education Science Sports and Culture of Japan Grant No ZZ and the NSE RC Canada GL chen yong an zhang du edu cn Department of Mathematics Hangzhou Dian zi University Hangzhou China zz chen mail den dai ac jp Division of Information System Design Tokyo enki University Saitama Japan kennedy guo hui alberta ca Department of Computing Science University of Alberta Edmonton Alberta Canada Correspondence author xu georgia southern edu Department of Computer Science Georgia Southern University States boro USA

Fragments of the Past Cu rating Peer Support with Perpetrators of Domestic Violence Rosanna Bellini Open Lab School of Computing Newcastle University bellini newcastle ac uk Alexander Wilson Open Lab School of Architecture Planning and Landscape Newcastle University alexander wilson newcastle ac uk Jan David med in ck Open Lab School of Computing Newcastle University jan med in ck newcastle ac uk There is growing evidence that digital peer support networks can have positive influence on behaviour change and wellbeing outcomes for people who harm themselves and others However making and sustaining such networks are subject to ethical and pragmatic challenges particularly for perpetrators of domestic violence whom pose unique risks when brought together In this work we report on ten month study where we worked with six support workers and eighteen perpetrators in the design and deployment of Fragments of the Past socio material system that connects audio messages with tangible artefacts We share how crafting digitally augmented artefacts fragments of experiences of desisting from violence can translate messages for motivation and rapport between peers without subjecting the process to risks inherent with direct inter personal communication These insights provide the basis for practical considerations for future network design with challenging populations Human centered computing Human computer interaction HC Human centered computing HC theory concepts and models Human centered computing Empirical studies in HC Additional Keywords and Phrases Domestic Violence JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL NO JULY Beyond Low pass Filtering Graph Convolutional Networks with Automatic Filtering Zon gh an Wu Shi rui Pan Member IEEE Guo dong Long Jing Jiang and Cheng qi Zhang Senior Member IEEE Abstract Graph convolutional networks are becoming indispensable for deep learning from graph structured data Most of the existing graph convolutional networks share two big shortcomings First they are essentially low pass lter thus the potentially useful middle and high frequency band of graph signals are ignored Second the bandwidth of existing graph convolutional lter is ed Parameters of graph convolutional lter only transform the graph inputs without changing the curvature of graph convolutional lter function In reality we are uncertain about whether we should retain or cutoff the frequency at certain point unless we have expert domain knowledge In this paper we propose Automatic Graph Convolutional Networks Auto GC to capture the full spectrum of graph signals and automatically update the bandwidth of graph convolutional lter While it is based on graph spectral theory our Auto GC is also localized in space and has spatial form Experimental results show that Auto GC achieves sign cant improvement over baseline methods which only work slow pass lter Index Terms Graph convolutional networks graph signal processing graph neural networks cid

IQ uS UW Standard Model Physics and the Digital Quantum Revolution Thoughts about the Interface Natalie Kl co Alessandro Rogge ro and Martin Savage Institute for Quantum Information and Matter and Walter Burke Institute for Theoretical Physics California Institute of Technology Pasadena CA USA In Qu bator for Quantum Simulation IQ uS Department of Physics University of Washington Seattle WA USA Address after July Di parti men to di Fi sica University of Trento via Somma rive Pov Trento Italy Dated July Advances in isolating controlling and entangling quantum systems are transform ing what was once curious feature of quantum mechanics into vehicle for is rup ti ve sci en tic and technological progress Pursuing the vision articulated by Fey man concerted ort across many areas of research and development is intro duc ing prototypical digital quantum devices into the computing ecosystem available to domain scientists Through interactions with these early quantum devices the ab tract vision of exploring classically intractable quantum systems is evolving toward becoming tangible reality Beyond catalyzing these technological advances ent an le ment is enabling parallel progress as diagnostic for quantum correlations and as an organizational tool both guiding improved understanding of quantum many body systems and quantum el theories de ning and emerging from the Standard Model From the perspective of three domain science theorists this article compiles thoughts about the interface on entanglement complexity and quantum simulation in an ort to contextual ize recent NI SQ era progress with the sci en tic objectives of nuclear and high energy physics nat kl co caltech edu rogge ro uw edu mj uw edu

Semi Supervised Learning with Multi Head Co Training Ming cai Chen Yun tao Du Yi Zhang Shu wei Qian Chong jun Wang State Key Laboratory for Novel Software Technology at Nanjing University Nanjing University Nanjing China chen mc du yun tao ju zhang Qian SW smail ju edu cn ch wang ju edu cn Abstract Co training extended from self training is one of the frameworks for semi supervised learning It works at the cost of training extra classier where the algorithm should be delicately designed to prevent individual classier from col lapsing into each other In this paper we present simple and efc ent co training algorithm named Multi Head Co Training for semi supervised imageclass cation By integrating base learners into multi head structure the model is in minimal amount of extra parameters Every classic ation head in the unie model interacts with its peers through Weak and Strong Augmentation strategy achieving single view co training without promoting diversity explicitly The ef fec ti ve ness of Multi Head Co Training is demonstrated in an empirical study on standard semi supervised learning benchmarks

Hol ono mic quantum manipulation in the We yl Disk Victor Boo gers Janis Erd man is and Yul Nazarov Ka li Institute of Nano science Delft University of Technology CJ Delft The Netherlands It has been shown that We yl point in superconducting nano structure may give rise to We yl disk where two quantum states are almost degenerate in manifold in the parametric space This opens up the possibility of hol ono mic quantum manipulation transformation of the wave function upon adiabatic change of the parameters within the degenerate manifold In this paper we investigate in detail the opportunities for hol ono mic manipulation in We yl disks We compute the connection at the manifold in quasi classical approximation to show it is Abelian and can be used for phase gate To provide closed example of quantum manipulation that includes state preparation and read out we augment the hol ono mic gate with change of parameters that brings the system out of the degenerate subspace For numerical illustrations we use nite value of quasi classical parameter and exact quantum dynamics We investigate the del it of an example gate for die rent execution times

Electronic structure of Co As Ca Sr Ba Eu studied using angle resolved photo emission spectroscopy and theoretical calculations Dhaka Lee An and Abhi shek Pandey Johnston Harmon and Adam Kaminski The Ames Laboratory DOE and Department of Physics and Astronomy Iowa State University Ames Iowa USA Department of Physics Indian Institute of Technology Delhi Hau Khas New Delhi India Dated July We present comprehensive study of the low energy band structure and Fermi surface FS topology of Co As Ca Sr Ba Eu using high resolution angle resolved photo emission spectroscopy The experimental FS topology and band dispersion data are compared with theoretical full potential linear zed augmented plane wave FP LAP calculations which yielded reasonably good agreement We demonstrate that the FS maps of Co As are sign cant ly die rent from those of the parent compounds of Fe based high temperature superconductors Further the FS of CaCo As do not show sign cant changes across its anti ferromagnetic transition temperature The band dispersions extracted in die rent momentum directions show small electron pocket at the center and large electron pocket at the corner of the Brill ou in zone BZ The absence of the hole FS in these compounds does not allow nesting between pockets at the Fermi energy which is in contrast to Fe As type parent compounds of the iron based superconductors Interestingly we nd that the hole bands are moved meV below depending on the element Moreover the existence of nearly at bands in the vicinity of are consistent with the large density of states at These results are important to understand the physical properties as well as the possibility of the emergence of superconductivity in related materials

DA CY UNIFIED FRAMEWORK FOR DANISH NLP Kenneth nev old sen Lasse Hansen Interacting Minds Centre Department of Clinical Medicine Center for Humanities Computing Aarhus Center for Humanities Computing Aarhus Aarhus University Aarhus University Jen sChr Sko us Ve Building door Jen sChr Sko us Ve Building door Denmark Aarhus Denmark Aarhus kenneth nev old sen cas au dk lasse hansen cl in au dk Krist offer Niel bo Interacting Minds Centre Center for Humanities Computing Aarhus Aarhus University Jen sChr Sko us Ve Building door Denmark Aarhus kl cas au dk ABSTRACT Danish natural language processing NLP has in recent years obtained considerable improvements with the addition of multiple new datasets and models However at present there is no coherent framework for applying state of the art models for Danish We present Da Cy unie framework for Danish NLP built on SpaCy Da Cy uses efc ent multi task models which obtain state of the art performance on named entity recognition part of speech tagging and dependency parsing Da Cy contains tools for easy integration of existing models such as for polarity emotion or subjectivity detection In addition we conduct series of tests for biases and robustness of Danish NLP pipelines through augmentation of the test set of DaNE Da Cy large compares favorably and is especially robust to long input lengths and spelling variations and errors All models except Da Cy large display sign cant biases related to ethnicity while only Polyglot shows sign cant gender bias We argue that for languages with limited benchmark sets data augmentation can be particularly useful for obtaining more realistic and ne grained performance estimates We provide series of augment ers as rst step towards more thorough evaluation of language models for low and medium resource languages and encourage further development Keywords Natural Language Processing Low resource NLP Data Augmentation Danish NLP

Learning interaction rules from multi animal trajectories via augmented behavioral models Keisuke Fujii Naoya Take ishi Nagoya University University of Applied Sciences RIKEN Center for Advanced Intelligence Project and Arts Western Switzerland ST PRESTO RIKEN Center for Advanced Intelligence Project Kazushi Tsu tsui Em yo Fuji oka Nozomi Nishi umi Ryo ya Tanaka Nagoya University Do shisha
