Susumu Takahashi Shi zuko Hi ryu Yoshinobu Kawahara Do shisha University Do shisha University Kyushu University RIKEN Center for Advanced Intelligence Project Abstract Extracting the interaction rules of biological agents from moving sequences pose challenges in various domains Granger causality is practical framework for analyzing the interactions from observed time series data however this framework ignores the structures of the generative process in animal behaviors which may lead to interpretation al problems and sometimes erroneous assessments of causality In this paper we propose new framework for learning Granger causality from multi animal trajectories via augmented theory based behavioral models with interpret able data driven models We adopt an approach for augmenting incomplete multi agent behavioral models described by time varying dynamical systems with neural networks For efc ent and interpret able learning our model leverages theory based architectures separating navigation and motion processes and the theory guided regular iz ation for reliable behavioral modeling This can provide interpret able signs of Granger causal effects overtime when spec ic others cause the approach or separation In experiments using synthetic datasets our method achieved better performance than various baselines We then analyzed multi animal datasets of mice ies birds and bats which ve ried our method and obtained novel biological insights

Zero shot Visual Question Answering using Knowledge Graphs Zhuo Chen Jiao yan Chen Yu xia Geng Je Pan Zon gang Yuan and Hua jun Chen cid College of Computer Science Hangzhou Innovation Center Zhejiang University AZ FT Joint Lab for Knowledge Engine zhuo chen geng hua jun sir zju edu cn Department of Computer Science University of Oxford jiao yan chen cs ox ac uk School of Informatics The University of Edinburgh https knowledge representation org pan NAI TO ce Hua wei Technologies Co Ltd yuan zon gang hua wei com Abstract Incorporating external knowledge to Visual Question An we ring QA has become vital practical need Existing methods mostly adopt pipeline approaches with die rent components for knowl edge matching and extraction feature learning etc However such pipeline approaches sue when some component does not perform well which leads to error cascading and poor overall performance Furthermore the majority of existing approaches ignore the answer bias issue many an wer may have never appeared during training unseen answers in real word application To bridge these gaps in this paper we propose Zero shot QA algorithm using knowledge graphs and mask based learning mechanism for better incorporating external knowledge and present new answer based Zero shot QA splits for the QA data set Experiments show that our method can achieve state of the art per for man ce in Zero shot QA with unseen answers meanwhile dramatically augment existing end to end models on the normal QA task Keywords Visual Question Answering Zero shot Learning Knowl edge Graph

Fine Grained Auto Augmentation for Multi Label Classic ation Ya Wang Peking University Ali baba Group He se nChen Fan gyi Zhang Yao hua Wang Xi yu Sun Ming Lin Hao Li Ali baba Group xi yu xy ali baba inc com Abstract Data augmentation is commonly used approach to improving the generalization of deep learning models Recent works show that learned data augmentation poli cie can achieve better generalization than hand crafted ones However most of these works use unie augmentation policies for all samples in data set which is observed not necessarily bene cia for all labels in multi label classic ation tasks some policies may have negative impacts on some labels while be netting the others To tackle this problem we propose novel Label Based Auto Aug men ation LB Aug method for multi label scenarios where augmentation policies are generated with respect to labels by an augmentation policy network The policies are learned via reinforcement learning using policy gradient methods providing mapping from instance labels to their optimal augmentation policies Numerical experiments show that our LB Aug outperforms previous state of the art augmentation methods by large margins in multiple benchmarks on image and video classic ation

Data driven Modeling of the Mechanical Behavior of Anisotropic Soft Biological Tissue Va hid ullah Tac Vive ree Manuel Rau sch and Adrian Te pole School of Mechanical Engineering Purdue University West Lafayette IN USA Department of Aerospace Engineering and Engineering Mechanics the University of Texas at Austin Austin TX USA Weldon School of Biomedical Engineering Purdue University West Lafayette IN USA Abstract Constitutive models that describe the mechanical behavior of soft tissues have advanced greatly over the past few decades These expert models are general iz able and require the calibration of number of parameters to ex peri mental data However inherent pitfalls stemming from the restriction to spec ic functional form include poor ts to the data non uniqueness of and high sensitivity to parameters In this study we design and train fully connected neural networks as material models to replace or augment expert models To guarantee objectivity the neural network takes is ocho ric strain in variants as inputs and outputs the value of strain energy and its derivatives with respect to the in variants Convexity of the material model is enforced through the loss function Direct prediction of the derivative functions rather than just predicting the energy serves two purposes it provides ex bil it during training and it enables the calculation of the elasticity tensor through back propagation We showcase the ability of the neural net work to learn the mechanical behavior of porcine and murine skin from bi axial test data Crucially we show that multi del it scheme which combines high del it experimental data with low del it analytical data yields the best performance The neural network material model can then be interpreted as the best extension of an expert model it learns the features that an expert has encoded in the analytical model while ting the experimental data better Finally we implemented general user material subroutine UM AT for the nite element software Aba qu and there by make our advances available to the broader computational community We expect that the methods and software generated in this work will broaden the use of data driven constitutive models in biomedical applications Keywords Machine Learning Nonlinear nite elements Constitutive modeling Aba qu User Subroutine UM AT multi del it models Skin mechanics

CoBE RL Contrastive BERT for Reinforcement Learning Andrea Bani no Adri Pui domenech Badia Jacob Walker Deep Mind Deep Mind Deep Mind London UK London UK London UK bani no deep mind com adri ap deep mind com jc walker deep mind com Tim Sch olte Jovan Mitro vic Charles Blundell Deep Mind Deep Mind Deep Mind London UK London UK London UK tim sch olte deep mind com mitro vic deep mind com blundell deep mind com Abstract Many reinforcement learning RL agents require large amount of experience to solve tasks We propose Contrastive BERT for RL COBE RL an agent that combines new contrastive loss and hybrid STM transformer architecture to tackle the challenge of improving data efc ien cy COBE RL enables efc ent robust learning from pixels across wide range of domains We use bidirectional masked prediction in combination with generalization of recent contrastive methods to learn better representations for transformers in RL without the need of hand engineered data augmentations Wend that COBE RL consistently improves performance across the full Atari suite set of control tasks and challenging environment

Abstract Motivation Computational models that accurately identify high an it protein compound pairs can accelerate drug discovery pipelines These models aim to learn binding me chan ics through drug target interaction datasets and use the learned knowledge for predicting the an it of an input protein compound pair However the datasets they rely on bear mis leading patterns that bias models towards memorizing data set spec ic bio molecule properties instead of learning binding mechanics This results in models that struggle while predicting drug target ani ties DT especially between de novo biomolecules Here we present Deb as dDT the rst DT model de biasing approach that avoids data set biases in order to boost an it prediction for novel biomolecules De biased DT uses ensemble learning and sample weight adaptation for bia sident cation and avoidance and is applicable to almost all existing DT prediction models Results The results show that De biased DT can boost models while predicting the inter actions between novel biomolecules Known biomolecules also be net from the performance improvement especially when the test biomolecules are dissimilar to the training set Accent ure at Check That Interesting claim ident cation and ranking with con textually sensitive lexical training data augmentation Evan Williams Paul Rodrigues and Sie Tr an Accent ure Glebe Rd Arlington USA williams accent ure com paul rodrigues accent ure com sie tr an accent ure com Abstract This paper discusses the approach used by the Accent ure Team for CLEF Check That Lab Task to identify whether claim made in social media would be interesting to wide audience and should be fact checked Twitter training and test data were pro vi ded in English Arabic Spanish Turkish and Bulgarian Claims were to be class ed check worthy not check worthy and ranked in priority order for the fact checker Our method used deep neural network trans former models with con textually sensitive lexical augmentation applied on the supplied training datasets to create additional training samples This augmentation approach improved the performance for all languages Overall our architecture and data augmentation pipeline produced the best submitted system for Arabic and performance scales according to the quantity of provided training data for English Spanish Turkish and Bulgarian This paper investigates the deep neural network architectures for each language as well as the provided data to examine why the ap roach worked so eec iv ely for Arabic and discusses additional data augmentation measures that should could be useful to this problem Keywords fact checking claim retrieval check worthy BERT RoBERTa

Worst Case Welfare of Item Pricing in the Tollbooth Problem Zi han Tan Yi feng Teng Ming fei Zhao July Abstract We study the worst case welfare of item pricing in the tollbooth problem The problem was rst introduced by Guru swami et al and is special case of the combinatorial auction in which ul each of the items in the auction is an edge of some underlying graph and ii each of the buyers is single minded and only interested in buying all edges of single path We consider the competitive ratio between the hindsight optimal welfare and the optimal worst case welfare among all item pricing mechanisms when the order of the arriving buyers is adversarial On the one hand we prove an lower bound of the competitive ratio for general graphs We show that an competitive ratio is unavoidable even if the graph is grid or if the capacity of every edge is augmented by constant On the other hand we study the competitive ratio for special families of graphs In particular we improve the ratio when the input graph is tree from proved by Cheung and Swamy to We prove that the ratio is tight when is cycle andO log when is an outer planar graph All positive results above require that the seller can choose proper tie breaking rule to maximize the welfare In the paper we also consider the setting where the tie breaking power is on the buyers side the buyer can choose whether or not to buy her demand path when the total price of edges in the path equals her value We show that the gap between the two settings is at least constant even when the underlying graph is single path this special case is also known as the highway problem Meanwhile in this setting where buyers have the tie breaking power we also prove an upper bound of competitive ratio for special families of graphs University of Chicago Email zi han tan chicago edu Supported in part by NSF grant CCF University of Wisconsin Madison Email yi feng cs wis edu Supported in part by NSF grant CCF and HF Yale University Email ming fei zhao yale edu Supported by the NSF Award CCF CAREER

Kit Net Self Supervised Learning to Kit Novel Objects into Novel Cavities Shiv in Dev gon Jeffrey Ich now ski Michael Daniel cz uk Daniel Brown Ashwin Bala krishna Shi in Joshi Eduardo Rocha Eugen Solow jo Ken Goldberg Abstract In industrial part kitti ng objects are inserted into cavities for transportation or subsequent assembly Kitti ng is critical step as it can decrease downstream processing and handling times and enable lower storage and shipping costs We present Kit Net framework for kitti ng previously unseen objects into cavities given depth images of both the target cavity and an object held by gripper in an unknown initial orientation Kit Net uses self supervised deep learning and data augmentation to train convolutional neural network CNN to robustly estimate rotations between objects and matching concave or convex cavities using large training data set of simulated depth images pairs Kit Net then uses the trained CNN to implement controller to orient and position novel objects for insertion into novel prismatic and conform al cavities Experiments in simulation suggest that Kit Net can orient objects to have average intersection volume between the object mesh and that of the target cavity Physical experiments with industrial objects succeed in of trials using baseline method and in of trials with Kit Net Video code and data are available at https it hub com Berkeley Automation Kit Net

JOURNAL OF LATEX CLASS FILES VOL NO AUGUST Towards Representation Identical Privacy Preserving Graph Neural Network via Split Learning Chuan qiang Shan Hui yun Jiao and Jie Fu Abstract In recent years the fast rise in number of studies on graph neural network GN has put it from the theories research to reality application stage Despite the encouraging performance achieved by GN less attention has been paid to the privacy preserving training and inference over distributed graph data in the related literature Due to the particularity of graph structure it is challenging to extend the existing private learning framework to GN Motivated by the idea of split learning we propose Server Aided Privacy preserving GN APG NN for the node level task on horizontally partitioned cross silo scenario It offers natural extension of centralized GN to isolated graph with max min pooling aggregation while guaranteeing that all the private data involved in computation still stays at local data holders To further enhancing the data privacy secure pooling aggregation mechanism is proposed Theoretical and experimental results show that the proposed model achieves the same accuracy as the one learned over the combined data Index Terms Privacy preserving graph neural networks split learning message passing cid

Graph Data Augmentation Strategy with Entropy Preserving Xue Liu Dan Sun Wei Wei Beijing System Design Institute of Electro Mechanic Engineering Beijing China School of Mathematical Sciences Bei hang University Beijing China Key Laboratory of Mathematics Informatics and Behavioral Semantics Ministry of Education China Beijing Advanced Innovation Center for Big Data and Brain Computing Bei hang University Beijing China Peng Cheng Laboratory Shenzhen Guangdong China Abstract The Graph Convolutional Networks CNs proposed by Kip and Welling are eec ti ve models for semi supervised learning but facing the obstacle of over smoothing which will weaken the re pre sent ation ability of CNs Recently some works are proposed to tackle with above limitation by randomly perturbing graph topology or feature matrix to generate data augmentations as input for training However these operations have to pay the price of information structure integrity breaking and inevitably sac rice information stochastic ally from original graph In this paper we introduce novel graph entropy den it ion as an quantitative index to evaluate feature information diu sion among graph Under considerations of preserving graph entropy we propose an eec ti ve strategy to generate perturbed training data using stochastic mechanism but guaranteeing graph topology integrity and with only small amount of graph entropy decaying Extensive experiments have been conducted on real world datasets and the results verify the eec ti ve ness of our proposed method in improving semi supervised node classic ation accuracy compared with surge of base lines Beyond that our proposed approach sign cant ly enhances the robustness and generalization ability of CNs during the training process Keywords Graph representation Information theory Statistical physics Corresponding author Email address we iw bu edu cn Wei Wei Pre print submitted to Journal of Pattern Recognition July

Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging data augmentation through conditional ICA Badr Taj in cid Hugo Richard cid Bertrand Thir ion In ria CEA Universit Paris clay France Abstract Advances in computational cognitive neuro imaging research are related to the availability of large amounts of labeled brain mag ing data but such data are scarce and expensive to generate While powerful data generation mechanisms such as Generative Adversarial Networks GANs have been designed in the last decade for computer vision such improvements have not yet carried over to brain imaging likely reason is that GANs training is ill suited to the noisy high dimensional and small sample data available in functional neuro imaging In this paper we introduce Conditional Independent Components Anal ys is Conditional ICA fast functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging fMRI data augmentation technique that leverages abundant resting state data to create images by sampling from an ICA decomposition We then propose mechanism to condition the generator on classes ob served with few samples We rst show that the generative mechanism is successful at synthesizing data indistinguishable from observations and that it yields gains in classic ation accuracy in brain decoding problems In particular it outperforms GANs while being much easier to optimize and interpret Lastly Conditional ICA enhances classic ation accuracy in eight datasets without further parameters tuning Keywords Conditional ICA Data generation Decoding studies

Linking Health News to Research Literature Jun Wang and Bei Yu Independent Researcher James ville NY USA School of Information Studies Syracuse University Abstract Accurately linking news articles to sci en tic research works is critical component in number of applications such as measuring the social impact of research work and detecting inaccuracies or distortions in science news Although the lack of links between news and literature has been challenge in these applications it is relatively unexplored research problem In this paper we designed and evaluated new approach that consists of augmenting latest named entity recognition techniques to extract various metadata and designing new elastic search engine that can facilitate the use of enriched metadata queries To evaluate our approach we constructed two datasets of paired news articles and research papers one is used for training models to extract metadata and the other for evaluation Our experiments showed that the new approach performed sign cant ly better than baseline approach used by alt metric com vs in terms of top accuracy To further demonstrate the effectiveness of the approach we also conducted study on health related press releases published on EurekA ler which showed that our approach was able to identify the corresponding research papers with top accuracy of atleast

Bayesian Lifetime Regression with Multi type Group shared Latent Heterogeneity Xu xue Sun Ming yang Li Department of Industrial and Management Systems Engineering University of South Florida USA Abstract Products manufactured from the same batch or utilized in the same region often exhibit correlated lifetime observations due to the latent heterogeneity caused by the influence of shared but unobserved co variate The unavailable group shared co variate involve multiple different types discrete continuous or mixed type and induce different structures of indispensable group shared latent heterogeneity Without carefully capturing such latent heterogeneity the lifetime modeling accuracy will be significantly undermined In this work we propose generic Bayesian lifetime modeling approach by comprehensively investigating the structures of group shared latent heterogeneity caused by different types of group shared unobserved co variate The proposed approach is flexible to characterize multi type group shared latent heterogeneity in lifetime data Besides it can handle the case of lack of group membership information and address the issue of limited sample size Bayesian sampling algorithm with data augmentation technique is further developed to jointly quantify the influence of observed co variate and group shared latent heterogeneity Further we conduct comprehensive numerical study to demonstrate the improved performance of proposed modeling approach via comparison with alternative models We also present empirical study results to investigate the impacts of group number and sample size per group on estimating the group shared latent heterogeneity and to demonstrate model ident if ability of proposed approach for different structures of unobserved group shared co variate We also present real case study to illustrate the effectiveness of proposed approach Keywords Group shared latent heterogeneity Group shared unobserved co variate Lifetime model Bayesian estimation Data augmentation

Minimizing Safety Interference for Safe and Comfortable Automated Driving with Distribution al Reinforcement Learning Dani al Kam ran Ti zi an Engel ge Marvin Busch Johannes Fischer and Christoph Stiller Abstract Despite recent advances in reinforcement learning RL its application in safety critical domains like autonomous vehicles is still challenging Although punishing RL agents for risky situations can help to learn safe policies it may also lead to highly conservative behavior In this paper we propose distribution al RL framework in order to learn adaptive policies that can tune their level of con serva iv it at run time based on the desired comfort and utility Using proactive safety ver cation approach the proposed framework can guarantee that actions generated from RL are fail safe according to the worst case assumptions Concurrently the policy is encouraged to minimize safety interference and generate more comfortable behavior We trained and evaluated the proposed approach and baseline policies using high level simulator with variety of randomized scenarios including several corner cases which rarely happen in reality but are very crucial In light of our experiments the behavior of policies learned using distribution al RL can be adaptive at run time and robust to the environment uncertainty Quantitatively the learned distribution al RL agent drives in average seconds faster Fig Overview of the merging scenario and the proposed than the normal policy and requires less safety distribution al reinforcement learning framework for auto interference compared to the rule based policy with slightly increasing the average crossing time We also study sensitivity mated navigation at similar occluded intersections back of the learned policy in environments with higher perception ground image source noise and show that our algorithm learns policies that can still drive reliable when the perception noise is two times higher than the training cong ration for automated merging and crossing at occluded intersections generate risky behavior during training by receiving big punishments for having collisions or being in risky

irma lya Thakur Chia Han Framework for Personalized Intelligent Assistant to Elderly People for Activities of Daily Living irma lya Thakur thakur na mail uc edu Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science University of Cincinnati Cincinnati OH USA Chia Han han uc mail uc edu Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science University of Cincinnati Cincinnati OH USA Abstract The increasing population of elderly people is associated with the need to meet their increasing requirements and to provide solutions that can improve their quality of life in smart home In addition to fear and anxiety towards interfacing with systems cognitive disabilities weakened memory disorganized behavior and even physical limitations are some of the problems that elderly people tend to face with increasing age The essence of providing technology based solutions to address these needs of elderly people and to create smart and assisted living spaces for the elderly lies in developing systems that can adapt by addressing their diversity and can augment their performances in the context of their day to day goals Therefore this work proposes framework for development of Personalized Intelligent Assistant to help elderly people perform Activities of Daily Living ADL in smart and connected Internet of Things oT based environment This Personalized Intelligent Assistant can analyze different tasks performed by the user and recommend activities by considering their daily routine current affective state and the underlining user experience To uphold the efficacy of this proposed framework it has been tested on couple of datasets for modelling an average user and specific user respectively The results presented show that the model achieves performance accuracy of when modelling specific user which is considerably higher than its performance while modelling an average user this upholds the relevance for development and implementation of this proposed framework Keywords Affect Aware Systems Behavior Analysis Smart and Assisted Living Smart Home User Experience Affective States Human Computer Interaction Elderly People

Local Search for Weighted Tree Augmentation and Steiner Tree Vera Trau Rico Zen kl use Abstract We present technique that allows for improving on some relative greedy procedures by well chosen non oblivious local search algorithms Relative greedy procedures are particular type of greedy algorithm that start with simple though weak solution and iterative ly replace parts of this starting solution by stronger components Some well known applications of relative greedy algorithms include approximation algorithms for Steiner Tree and more recently for connectivity augmentation problems The main application of our technique leads to approximation for Weighted Tree Aug men ation improving on recent relative greedy based method with approximation factor ln Furthermore we show how our local search technique can be applied to Steiner Tree leading to anal ter native way to obtain the currently best known approximation factor of ln Contrary to prior methods our approach is purely combinatorial without the need to solve an LP Nevertheless the so lu tion value can still be bounded in terms of the well known hyper graphic LP leading to an alternative and arguably simpler technique to bound its integral it gap by ln This project received funding from Swiss National Science Foundation grant and the European Research Council ER under the European Unions Horizon research and innovation programme grant agreement No Department of Mathematics ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Email vera trau for math et hz ch Department of Mathematics ETH Zurich Zurich Switzerland Email rico et hz ch

ob ser ing strategy on Ne classic ation using the simulated multi band light curves from the Photometric LS ST Astronomical Time Series Classic ation Challenge PLAsTiC First we augment the imu late training set to be representative of the photometric redshift distribution per supernovae class the cadence of observations and the ux uncertainty distribution of the test set Then we build classier observations does not impact classic ation performance as long as uci ent observations are available on either side due to the eec ti ve ness of the Gaussian process interpolation This analysis is the Recognizing bird species in diverse soundscapes under weak supervision Christof Henkel Pascal Pfeiffer and Philipp Singer NVIDIA Munich Germany RW TH Aachen University Aachen Germany Mountain View USA All authors contributed equally Abstract We present robust classification approach for avian vocalization in complex and diverse soundscapes achieving second place in the Bird CLEF challenge We illustrate how to make full use of pre trained convolutional neural networks by using an efficient modeling and training routine supplemented by novel augmentation methods There by we improve the generalization of weakly labeled crowd sourced data to productive data collected by autonomous recording units As such we illustrate how to progress towards an accurate automated assessment of avian population which would enable global biodiversity monitoring at scale impossible by manual annotation Keywords Bird CLEF Life CLEF audio bioacoustics fine grained classification bird recognition Ka gg le

On Two Pass Streaming Algorithms for Maximum Bipartite Matching Christian Konrad and heer an Nai du Department of Computer Science University of Bristol UK christian konrad heer an nai du bristol ac uk Abstract We study two pass streaming algorithms for Maximum Bipartite Matching MB All known two pass streaming algorithms for MB operate in similar fashion They compute maximal matching in the rst pass and nd augmenting paths in the second in order to augment the matching found in the rst pass Our aim is to explore the limitations of this approach and to determine whether current techniques can be used to further improve the state of the art algorithms We give the following results We show that every two pass streaming algorithm that solely computes maximal matching cs in the rst pass and outputs cid approximation requires log og space for every cid where is the number of vertices of the input graph This result is obtained by extending the Ruz Sze mere di graph construction of Go el et al SODA so as to ensure that the resulting graph has close to perfect matching the key property needed in our construction This result may be of independent interest Furthermore we combine the two main techniques sub sampling followed by the Greedy matching algorithm Konrad MFC which gives approximation and the computation of degree bounded semi matching Esf and ari et al ICD MW Kale and Tiro kar APPROX which gives approximation and obtain meta algorithm that yields Konrad and Esf and ari et al algorithms as special cases This unies two strands of research By optimizing parameters we discover that Konrad algorithm is optimal for the implied class of algorithms and perhaps surprisingly that there is second optimal algorithm We show that the analysis of our meta algorithm is best possible Our results imply that further improvements if possible require new techniques

Survey on Deep Domain Adaptation and Tiny Object Detection Challenges Techniques and Datasets MUHAMMAD MU ZAM MUL and XI LI College of Computer Science Zhejiang University China Deep learning DL and computer vision CV offered trending role in object detection OD object tracking pedestrian detection and autonomous vehicles from the last few decades Several old and recent approaches were proposed to solve these computer vision and deep learning based problems with detection tracking techniques algorithms and data sources In recent decades this field gained importance due to the rising interest in brain inspired human recognition and detection technologies Using online offline data about images and videos researchers are intensively modeling sentiments and computational analysis Computer vision based artificial neural networks ANN and convolutional neural network CNN based approaches providing robust solutions This survey paper specially analyzed computer vision based object detection challenges and solutions by different techniques We mainly highlighted object detection by three different trending strategies domain adaptive deep learning based approaches discrepancy based Adversarial based Reconstruction based Hybrid We examined general as well as tiny object detection related challenges and offered solutions by historical and comparative analysis In part we mainly focused on tiny object detection techniques multi scale feature learning Data augmentation Training strategy TS Context based detection GAN based detection In part To obtain knowledge able findings we discussed different object detection methods convolutions and convolutional neural networks CNN pooling operations with trending types Furthermore we explained results with the help of some object detection algorithms CNN Fast CNN Faster CNN YO LO and SSD which are generally considered the base bone of CV CNN and OD We performed comparative analysis on different datasets such as MS COCO PASCAL VOC and Image Net to analyze results and present findings At the end we showed future directions with existing challenges of the field In the future OD methods and models can be analyzed for real time object detection tracking strategies CCS Concepts Deep learning Object detection Challenges Deep domain adaptation Tiny objects Techniques Methods Additional Key Words and Phrases datasets models Overturning negative cons tru al of quantum superposition Arkady Bo lot in Ben Gurion University of the Negev Beersheba Israel July Abstract Cons tru al of observable facts or events that is the manner in which we understand reality is based not only on mathematical formulas of theory suggested as reasonable explanation for physical phenomena like general relativity or quantum mechanics but also on mathematical model of reasoning used to analyze and appraise statements regarding the objective world for example logic of one type or the other Hence every time that certain cons tru al of reality encounters problem there is choice between amo dication to the mathematical formalism of the physical theory and change in the model of reasoning case in point is negative cons tru al of quantum superposition causing the problem of de nite outcomes To be sure according to the said cons tru al it is not the case that system being in superposition of states is exclusively in one of the states constituting the superposition which in turn implies that macroscopically die ring outcomes of observation may appear all at once The usual approach to the problem of de nite outcomes is to modify the quantum mathematical formalism by adding to it some extra postulates for instance the postulate of wave function collapse However since none of the extra postulates proposed so far has gained broad acceptance one may try another avenue to resolve the problem namely to replace logic with an alternative mathematical model of re so ning This possibility is studied in the present paper Keywords Measurement problem Problem of de nite outcomes Instrumentalist description of quantum mechanics Quantum superposition Quantum fundamentalism Macroscopic real is Propositional logic Predicate logic Quantum logic Analytic statements Truth assignment Probabilistic semantics

Lesion based Contrastive Learning for Diabetic Ret in opa thy Grading from Fund us Images Yi in Huang Li Lin Pu in Cheng Junya yu Xiao ying Tang cid Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering Southern University of Science and Technology Shenzhen China tang xy sus tech edu cn School of Electronics and Information Technology Sun Yat sen University Guangzhou China Abstract Manually annotating medical images is extremely ex pen sive especially for large scale datasets Self supervised contrastive learn ing has been explored to learn feature representations from unlabeled images However unlike natural images the application of contrastive learning to medical images is relatively limited In this work we pro pose self supervised framework namely lesion based contrastive learn ing for automated diabetic ret in opa thy DR grading Instead of taking entire images as the input in the common contrastive learning scheme lesion patches are employed to encourage the feature extractor to learn representations that are highly disc rim native for DR grading We also investigate die rent data augmentation operations in de ning our con tr asti ve prediction task Extensive experiments are conducted on the publicly accessible data set Eye PAC demonstrating that our proposed framework performs outstandingly on DR grading in terms of both linear evaluation and transfer capacity evaluation Keywords Contrastive learning self supervised learning lesion di be tic ret in opa thy fund us image

Learning Augmented Online Facility Location Dimitri Fota is Evan geli Ger gat soul National Technical University of Athens University of Wisconsin Madison fota is cs ntu gr eva ger cs wis edu Them is Gou leak is Nikola Patris Max Planck Institute for Informatics National Technical University of Athens gou leak mp in mpg de nik patris gmail com Abstract Following the research agenda initiated by Mun oz Vas sil its kii and Ly our is Vas sil its kii on learning augmented online algorithms for classical online optimization problems in this work we consider the Online Facility Location problem under this framework In Online Facility Location OF demands arrive one by one in metric space and must be irrevocably assigned to an open facility upon arrival without any knowledge about future demands We present an online algorithm for OF that exploits potentially imperfect predictions on the locations of the optimal facilities We prove that the competitive ratio decreases smoothly from sub logarithmic in the number of demands to constant as the error the total distance of the predicted locations to the optimal facility locations decreases towards zero We complement our analysis with matching lower bound establishing that the dependence of the algorithms competitive ratio on the error is optimal up to constant factors Finally we evaluate our algorithm on real world data and compare our learning augmented approach with the current best online algorithm for the problem

Down link IMO SMA with Successive Null Space Precoding ravi ndh Krishna moor thy and Robert Schober Friedrich Alexander Universit Erlangen rnberg Germany Fraunhofer Institute for Integrated Circuits IS Erlangen Germany Abstract In this paper we consider the pre code design for an under loaded or critically loaded down link multi user multiple input multiple output IMO communication system We propose novel precoding and decoding schemes which enhance system performance based on rate splitting at the transmitter and single stage successive interference cancellation at the receivers The proposed successive null space SNS precoding utilizes linear combinations of the null space basis vectors of the successively augmented IMO channel matrices of the users as precoding vectors to adjust the inter user interference experienced by the receivers We formulate an on convex weighted sum rate optimization problem for the precoding vectors and the associated power allocation for the proposed SNS based IMO rate splitting multiple access SMA scheme We obtain suboptimal solution for this problem via successive convex approximation Moreover we study the robustness of the proposed precoding scheme to imperfect channel state information CSI at the base station via derivative based sensitivity analysis Our analysis and simulation results reveal the enhanced performance and robustness of the proposed SNS based IMO SMA scheme over several baseline multi user IMO schemes especially for imperfect CSI

IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON VISUALIZATION AND COMPUTER GRAPHICS De Humor Visual Analytics for Decomposing Humor Xing bo Wang Yao Ming Tongs huang Wu Hai peng Zeng Yong Wang and Hua min Qu Abstract Despite being critical communications kill grasping humor is challenging successful use of humor requires mixture of both engaging content build up and an appropriate vocal delivery pause Prior studies on computational humor emphasize the textual and audio features immediately next to the punchline yet overlooking longer term context setup Moreover the theories are usually too abstract for understanding each concrete humor snippet Toll in the gap we develop De Humor visual analytical system for analyzing humorous behaviors in public speaking To intuitively reveal the building blocks of each concrete example De Humor decomposes each humorous video into multi modal features and provides inline annotations of them on the video script In particular to better capture the build ups we introduce content repetition as complement to features introduced in theories of computational humor and visualize them in context linking graph To help users locate the punchlines that have the desired features to learn we summarize the content with keywords and humor feature statistics on an augmented time matrix With case studies on stand up comedy shows and TED talks we show that De Humor is able to highlight various building blocks of humor examples In addition expert interviews with communication coaches and humor researchers demonstrate the effectiveness of De Humor for multi modal ul humor analysis of speech content and vocal delivery Index Terms Humor Context Multi modal Features Visualization cid

Probabilistic Ver cation of Neural Networks Against Group Fairness Bing Sun Jun Sun Ting Dai and Li jun Zhang Singapore Management University Hua wei Singapore Chinese Academy of Science Abstract Fairness is crucial for neural networks which are used in ap pli cations with important societal implication Recently there have been multiple attempts on improving fairness of neural networks with focus on fairness testing generating individual discriminatory instances and fairness training enhancing fairness through augmented train ing In this work we propose an approach to formally verify neural networks against fairness with focus on independence based fairness such as group fairness Our method is built upon an approach for learning Markov Chains from user provided neural network feed forward neural network or are current neural network which is guaranteed of ili tate sound analysis The learned Markov Chain not only allows us to verify with Probably Approximate Correctness guarantee whether the neural network is fair or not but also facilities sensitivity analysis which helps to understand why fairness is violated We demonstrate that with our analysis results the neural weights can be optimized to improve fair ness Our approach has been evaluated with multiple models trained on benchmark datasets and the experiment results show that our approach is eec ti ve and ec ent

AN FIC Image Compression Using Augmented Normalizing Flows Yung Han Ho Chi Chun Chan Wen Hsiao Peng Senior Member IEEE Hsu eh Ming Hang Fellow IEEE and Marek Do man ski Senior Member IEEE This paper introduces an end to end learned image compression system termed AN FIC based on Augmented Normalizing Flows ANF ANF is new type of ow model which stacks multiple variation al auto encoders VA for greater model expressiveness The VA based image compression has gone mainstream showing promising compression performance Our work presents the rst attempt to leverage VA based compression in ow based framework AN FIC advances further compression efc ien cy by stacking and extending hierarchically multiple AEs The invert bil it of ANF together with our training strategies enables AN FIC to support wide range of quality levels without changing the encoding and decoding networks Extensive experimental results show that in terms of SNR RGB AN FIC performs comparably to or better than the state of the art learned image compression Moreover it performs close to VC intra coding from low rate compression upton early lossless compression In particular AN FIC achieves the state of the art performance when extended with conditional convolution for variable rate compression with single model Index Terms Learning based image compression ow based image compression augmented normalizing ow nearly lossless image compression variable rate image compression

pattern recognition approach for distinguishing between prose and poetry Henrique de Arruda Sandro Rei Filip Silva Diego man cio and Luciano da Costa IS Foundation Turin Italy Sao Carlos Institute of Physics University of Sao Paulo Sao Carlos Brazil Indiana University Network Science Institute Bloomington Indiana USA Institute of Mathematics and Computer Sciences University of Sao Paulo Sao Carlos Brazil Dated July Abstract Poetry and prose are written artistic expressions that help us to appreciate the reality we live Each of these styles has its own set of subjective properties such as rhyme and rhythm which are easily caught by human readers eye and ear With the recent advances in art ici al intelligence the gap between humans and machines may have decreased and today we observe algorithms mastering tasks that were once exclusively performed by humans In this paper we propose an automated method to distinguish between poetry and prose based solely on aural and rhythmic properties In other to compare prose and poetry rhythms we represent the rhymes and phones as temporal sequences and thus we propose procedure for extracting rhythmic features from these sequences The classic ation of the considered texts using the set of features extracted resulted in best accuracy of obtained with neural network Interestingly by using an approach based on complex networks to visualize the similarities between the die rent texts considered we found that the patterns of poetry vary much more than prose Consequently much richer and complex set of rhythmic possibilities tends to be found in that modality This author was at the Sao Carlos Institute of Physics University of Sao Paulo until st May

Transport away your problems Calibrating stochastic simulations with optimal transport Chris Pollard Philipp Windisch hofer Department of Physics University of Oxford Keble Road Oxford United Kingdom Abstract Stochastic simulators are an indispensable tool in many branches of science Often based on rst principles they deliver series of samples whose distribution implicitly de nes probability measure to describe the phenomena of interest However the del it of these simulators is not always uci ent for all sci en tic purposes necessitating the construction of ad hoc corrections to calibrate the simulation and ensure that its output is faithful representation of reality In this paper we leverage methods from transportation theory to construct such corrections in systematic way We use neural network to compute minimal modi cations to the individual samples produced by the simulator such that the resulting distribution becomes properly calibrated We illustrate the method and its be nets in the context of experimental particle physics where the need for calibrated stochastic simulators is particularly pronounced

Compound Figure Separation of Biomedical Images with Side Loss Tianyu an Yao Chang Qu Quan Liu Ruining Deng Yuan han Tian Jia chen Xu adarsh ha Shun xing Bao Me ngyang Zhao Agnes Fogo Bennett Land man Cat ie Chang Hai chun Yang and Yuan kai Huo Vanderbilt University Nashville TN USA Vanderbilt University Medical Center Nashville TN USA Tufts University Medford MA USA Abstract Unsupervised learning algorithms self supervised learning auto encoder contrastive learning allow deep learning models to learn effective im age representations from large scale unlabeled data In medical image an aly is even un annotated data can be if cult to obtain for individual labs For tu nat ely national level efforts have been made to provide efc ent access to ob tain biomedical image data from previous sci en tic publications For instance NIH has launched the Open cid search engine that provides large scale image database with free access However the images in sci en tic publications consist of considerable amount of compound gur es with subplots To extract and cu rate individual subplots many different compound gu re separation approaches have been developed especially with the recent advances in deep learning How ever previous approaches typically required resource extensive bounding box an notation to train detection models In this paper we propose simple compound gu re separation Sim CFS framework that uses weak classic ation annotations from individual images Our technical contribution is three fold we intro duce new side loss that is designed for compound gu re separation we introduce an intra class image augmentation method to simulate hard cases the proposed framework enables an efc ent deployment to new classes of im ages without requiring resource extensive bounding box annotations From the results the Sim CFS achieved new state of the art performance on the Image CLEF Compound Figure Separation Database The source code of Sim CFS is made publicly available at https it hub com rl blab ImageS epe ration Keywords Compound gur es Separation Biomedical data Deep learning

Pre print TRANSL TO TRON ROBUST DIRECT SPEECH TO SPEECH TRANSLATION Ye Jia Michelle Tad mor Rama no vich Tal Re mez Roi omer antz Google Research ji aye tad mor tal re mez google com ABSTRACT We present Transl to tron neural direct speech to speech translation model that can be trained end to end Transl to tron consists of speech encoder phoneme decoder amel spec tr ogram synthesizer and an attention module that connects all the previous three components Experimental results suggest that Transl to tron outperforms the original Transl to tron by large margin in terms of translation quality and predicted speech naturalness and drastically improves the robustness of the predicted speech by mitigating over generation such as babbling or long pause We also propose new method for retaining the source speakers voice in the translated speech The trained model is restricted to retain the source speakers voice and unlike the original Transl to tron it is not able to generate speech in different speakers voice making the model more robust for production deployment by mitigating potential misuse for creating spoon audio artifacts When the new method is used together with simple concatenation based data augmentation the trained Transl to tron model is able to retain each speakers voice for input with speaker turns

lanc del edu marie oe hler ice cube wis edu Ice Top the surface array of the Ice Cube Neutrino Observatory consists of ice Cherenkov tanks distributed over an area of km Besides being used save to for the in ice neutrino detector Ice Top is powerful cosmic ray detector In the upcoming years the capabilities of the Ice Top array will be enhanced by augmenting the existing ice Cherenkov tanks with an array of elevated scintilla tor panels and radio antennas Combining the data obtained from the die rent detectors will improve the reconstruction of cosmic ray energy and primary mass while reducing the energy threshold and increasing the aperture of the array In January prototype station consisting of scintillation detectors and antennas was deployed at the Ice Top site The prototype detectors are connected to one data acquisition system and the readout of the radio antennas is triggered using the signals from the scintilla tors This allows us to regularly observe secondary air shower particles hitting the scintilla tors as well as the radio emission of high energy air showers In this contribution we will discuss the results obtained from the prototype station in the past year present the rst cosmic ray air showers measured with this prototype station and show how the observations with the die rent detector types complement each other Corresponding authors Hr vo jeD uj ovi Hydro dynamical attractor and thermal particle production in heavy ion collision Lakshmi aik Sun il is wal ree lakshmi Am are sh is wal and reek an th Department of Sciences Amrit School of Engineering Coimbatore Amrit Vis hwa Vidya peeth am India Department of Nuclear and Atomic Physics Tata Institute of Fundamental Research Mumbai India School of Physical Sciences National Institute of Science Education and Research HB NI at ni dish India Dated July Study of thermal particle production is crucial to understand the space time evolution of the re ball produced in high energy heavy ion collisions We consider thermal particle production within the framework of relativistic viscous hydrodynamics and employ recently obtained analytical solutions of higher order viscous hydrodynamics with longitudinal Bjork en expansion to calculate the spectra of di leptons and photons Using these analytical solutions we constrain the allowed initial states by demanding positiv it and reality of energy density throughout the evolution Further we compute thermal particle spectra and study the particle yield in context of hydro dynamic attractor We nd that of all allowed solutions the evolution corresponding to attractor solution leads to maximum production of thermal particles

One Class Classic ation for Wafer Map using Adversarial Auto encoder with DSV DD Prior Ha Young Jo and Seong Whan Lee Department of Art ici al intelligence Korea University Seoul Republic of Korea ha young jo sw lee korea ac kr Abstract Recently semiconductors demand has exploded in virtual reality smartphones wearable devices the internet of things robotics and automobiles Semiconductor manufacturers want to make semi con duct or with high yields To do this manufacturers conduct many qu al it assurance activities Wafer map pattern classic ation is atypical way of quality assurance The defect pattern on the wafer map can tell us which process has problem Most of the existing wafer map classic tion methods are based on supervised methods The supervised methods tend to have high performance but they require extensive labor and ex pert knowledge to produce labeled datasets with balanced distribution in mind In the semiconductor manufacturing process it is challenging to get defect data with balanced distribution In this paper we propose one class classic ation method using an Adversarial Auto encoder with Deep Support Vector Data Description DSV DD prior which gen rates random vectors within the hyper sphere of DSV DD We use the WM data set which consists of real world wafer map We compare the score performance of our model with DSV DD and Keywords Wafer map classic ation One class classic ation DSV DD

IEEE ROBOTICS AND AUTOMATION LETTERS PRE PRINT VERSION JUNE Code Mapping Real Time Dense Mapping for Sparse SLAM using Compact Scene Representations Hide no bu Ma tsuki Ra luca Sc on Jan Czar now ski and Andrew Davison Abstract We propose novel dense mapping framework for sparse visual SLAM systems which leverages compact scene representation State of the art sparse visual SLAM systems pro vi de accurate and reliable estimates of the camera trajectory and locations of landmarks While these sparse maps are useful for localization they cannot be used for other tasks such as obstacle avoidance or scene understanding In this paper we propose dense mapping framework to complement sparse visual SLAM systems which takes as input the camera poses key frames and sparse points produced by the SLAM system and predicts dense depth image for every key frame We build on Code SLAM and use variation al auto encoder VA which is conditioned on intensity sparse depth and re projection error images from sparse SLAM to predict an uncertainty aware dense depth map The use of aVA then enables us to rene the dense depth images through multi view optimization which improves the consistency of overlapping frames Our mapper runs in separate thread in parallel to the SLAM system in loosely coupled manner This ex ble design allows for integration with arbitrary metric sparse SLAM systems without delaying the main SLAM process Our dense mapper can be used not only for local mapping but also globally consistent dense reconstruction through TS DF fusion We demonstrate our system running with ORB SLAM and show accurate dense depth estimation which could enable applications such as robotics and augmented reality Index Terms SLAM Mapping Vision Based Navigation Fig Top Real time dense mapping result left sparse SLAM right ours Our dense mapper completes the sparse scene geometry and renes it by sliding window multi view optimization Bottom An example of global

Re SSL Relational Self Supervised Learning with Weak Augmentation Ming kai Zheng Shan You Fei Wang Chen Qian Chang shui Zhang Xiao gang Wang Chang Xu Sense Time Research Department of Automation Tsinghua University Institute for Art ici al Intelligence Tsinghua University HUAI Beijing National Research Center for Information Science and Technology NR is The Chinese University of HongKong School of Computer Science Faculty of Engineering The University of Sydney zheng ming kai you shan wang fei qian chen sense time com cs mail tsinghua edu cn gwang ee cu hk edu hk xu sydney edu au Abstract Self supervised Learning SSL including the mainstream contrastive learning has achieved great success in learning visual representations without data annotations However most of methods mainly focus on the instance level information the different augmented images of the same instance should have the same feature or cluster into the same class but there is lack of attention on the relationships between different instances In this paper we introduced novel SSL paradigm which we term as relational self supervised learning Re SSL framework that learns representations by modeling the relationship between different instances Spec ic ally our proposed method employs sharpened distribution of pairwise similarities among different instances as relation metric which is thus utilized to match the feature embedding of different augmentations Moreover to boost the performance we argue that weak augmentations matter to represent more reliable relation and leverage momentum strategy for practical efc ien cy Experimental results show that our propose dReSS sign cant ly outperforms the previous state of the art algorithms in terms of both performance and training efc ien cy Code is available at https it hub com Kyle Zheng Re SSL

Toward Trustworthy Urban IT Systems The Bright and Dark Sides of Smart City Development Jung he um Park Hyun ji Chung Abstract In smart cities built on information and communication technology citizens and various IT systems Peoples viewpoint smarter and customized services interoperate in harmony Cloud computing and Internet of Things In this subsection we examine how cloud based services have technologies that have been developed for long time are making changed the lives of individuals modern cities smarter Smart cities can have positive impact on citizens but they can also make cities dangerous Today with the emerging reality of smart cities this paper looks at both the bright Collaboration People need to collaborate with others in and dark sides and provides foundation for supporting work their lives As the cloud computing environment matures workers related tasks of IT professionals as well as non IT experts involved can collaborate with others anywhere anytime and see each other in urban design and development in real time This has the advantage of promoting efficiency In particular the use of online collaborative services has rapidly Index Terms Smart city Urban science Cyber security Privacy increased during the recent OVID pandemic Smart healthcare Smart transportation Smart surveillance Smart grid Public safety Public health Environmental sustainability Usability Digital dependency Social networking In billion users use SNS such as Facebook and What App People can post text and upload

By PE VA Bayesian Pseudo core sets Exemplar VA Qing zhong School of Computer Science and Engineering University of Electronic Science and Technology of China zai std est edu cn Li rong He School of Computer Science and Engineering University of Electronic Science and Technology of China rong he gmail com Liang jian Wen The Noah sArk Lab Hua wei Technologies Company Limited wen liang jian hua wei com Shi yu Liu School of Computer Science and Engineering University of Electronic Science and Technology of China shy liu fox mail com Zeng linX School of Computer Science and Technology Harbin Institute of Technology Shenzhen Shenzhen China xu zeng lin hit edu cn Abstract Recent studies show that advanced priors play major role in deep generative mod els Exemplar VA as variant of VA with an exemplar based prior has achieved impressive results However due to the nature of model design an exemplar based model usually requires vast amounts of data to participate in training which leads to huge computational complexity To address this issue we propose Bayesian Pseudo core set sEx emp larVAE By PE VA new variant of VA with prior based on Bayesian pseudo core set The proposed prior is conditioned on small scale pseudo core set rather than the whole data set for reducing the computational cost and avoiding overt ting Simultaneously we obtain the optimal pseudo core set via stochastic optimization algorithm during VA training aiming to minimize the Kull back Leib ler divergence between the prior based on the pseudo core set and that based on the whole data set Experimental results show that By PE VA can achieve competitive improvements over the state of the art AEs in the tasks of density estimation representation learning and generative data augmentation Particularly on basic VA architecture By PE VA is up to times faster than Exemplar VA while almost holding the performance Code is available tour supplementary materials Corresponding author Pre print Under review

Bayesian Approach to Invariant Deep Neural Networks Nikolaos our do uk out as Marco Fed eric George sPan talos Mark van der Wilk Vincent For tu in Abstract Contributions We propose method to learn such weight sharing schemes We propose novel Bayesian neural network ar from data As proof of concept we focus on being in chi tec ture that can learn in variances from data variant to two types of transformations applied on images alone by inferring posterior distribution over namely rotations and ips However our algorithm can be different weight sharing schemes We show that applied to any other choice of symmetry as long as the cor our model outperforms other non invariant arch responding weight sharing scheme is available Apart from tec ture when trained on datasets that contain achieving good performance during inference our model is spec ic in variances The same holds true when able to learn such in variances from data This is achieved by no data augmentation is performed specifying probability distribution over the weight sharing schemes for the input layer thus formulating Bayesian neural network We specify prior over the parameters of this distribution and then perform MAP inference We em piri call verify and illustrate the capabilities of our model

GULS HAD SOS NOVI AND ME LDER BUILT INELASTIC TRANSFORMATIONS Built in Elastic Transformations for Improved Robustness Sada Guls had UvA Bosch Delta Lab guls had uva nl University of Amsterdam Ivan Sos novi The Netherlands sos novi uva nl Arnold me lder me lder uva nl Abstract We focus on building robustness in the convolutions of neural visual classier es pec ally against natural perturbations like elastic deformations occlusions and Gaussian noise Existing CNN show outstanding performance on clean images but fail to tackle naturally occurring perturbations In this paper west art from elastic perturbations which approximate local view point changes of the object We present elastically augmented convolutions EA Con by parameter zing lter as combination of ed elastically perturbed bases functions and trainable weights for the purpose of integrating unseen viewpoints in the CNN We show on CI FAR and ST datasets that the general ro bust ness of our method on unseen occlusion and Gaussian perturbations improves while even improving the performance on clean images slightly without performing any data augmentation

Faster Matching via Learned Dual Michael Di nitz Sung in Im Thomas Lavas tid Benjamin Moseley Sergei Vas sil its kii July Abstract recent line of research investigates how algorithms can be augmented with machine learned predictions to overcome worst case lower bounds This area has revealed interesting algorithmic insights into problems with particular success in the design of competitive online algorithms However the question of improving algorithm running times with predictions has largely been unexplored We take rst step in this direction by combining the idea of machine learned predictions with the idea of warm starting primal dual algorithms We consider one of the most important primitives in combinatorial optimization weighted bipartite matching and its generalization to matching We identify three key challenges when using learned dual variables in primal dual algorithm First predicted dual may be infeasible so we give an algorithm that cie ntl maps predicted infeasible dual to nearby feasible solutions Second once the dual are feasible they may not be optimal so we show that they can be used to quickly nd an optimal solution Finally such predictions are useful only if they can be learned so we show that the problem of learning dual for matching has low sample complexity We validate our theoretical dings through experiments on both real and synthetic data As result we give rigorous practical and empirically eec ti ve method to compute bipartite matching

Tumor CP Simple but Eec ti ve Object Level Data Augmentation for Tumor Segmentation Jia wei Yang cid Yao Zhang cid Yuan Liang Yang Zhang Lei He and Zhi qiang He Electrical and Computer Engineering University of California Los Angeles USA Institute of Computing Technology Chinese Academy of Sciences Beijing China University of Chinese Academy of Sciences Beijing China Le novo Corporate Research Development Le novo Ltd Beijing China Abstract Deep learning models are notoriously data hungry Thus there is an urging need for data ec ent techniques in medical image analysis where well annotated data are costly and time consuming to collect Motivated by the recently revived Copy Paste augmentation we propose Tumor CP simple but eec ti ve object level data aug men ation method tailored for tumor segmentation Tumor CP is online and stochastic providing unlimited augmentation possibilities for tumors subjects locations appearances as well as morph logie Experiments on kidney tumor segmentation task demonstrate that Tumor CP surpasses the strong baseline by remarkable margin of on tumor Dice Moreover together with image level data augmentation it beats the current state of the art by on tumor Dice Comprehensive ab la tion studies are performed to validate the eec ti ve ness of Tumor CP Meanwhile we show that Tumor CP can lead to striking improvements in extremely low data regimes Evaluated with only labeled data Tumor CP sign cant ly boosts tumor Dice by To the best of our knowledge this is the very rst work exploring and extending the Copy Paste design in medical imaging domain Code is available at https it hub com Yao Zhang Tumor CP Keywords Data ec ien cy Tumor segmentation Data augmentation

An overview of mixing augmentation methods and augmentation strategies Dominik Lewy and Jacek and zi uk Faculty of Mathematics and Information Science Warsaw University of Technology Kos zyk ow Warsaw Poland dominik lewy gmail com and zi uk mini pw edu pl Abstract Deep Convolutional Neural Networks have made an inc red ble progress in many Computer Vision tasks This progress however often relies on the availability of large amounts of the training data re qui red to prevent over ting which in many domains entails sign cant cost of manual data labeling An alternative approach is application of data augmentation DA techniques that aim at model regular iz ation by creating additional observations from the available ones This sur vey focuses on two DA research streams image mixing and automated selection of augmentation strategies First the presented methods are brie described and then qualitatively compared with respect to their key characteristics Various quantitative comparisons are also included based on the results reported in recent DA literature This review mainly covers the methods published in the materials of top tier conferences and in leading journals in the years Keywords Data Augmentation Image data Regular iz ation Mixing images Augmentation Strategies

JS Fake Chorales Synthetic Data set of Polyphonic Music with Human Annotation Omar Per acha Hum tap Inc London omar per acha gmail com Abstract High quality datasets for learning based modelling of polyphonic symbolic music remain less readily accessible at scale than in other domains such as language modelling or imageclass cation In particular datasets which contain information revealing insights about human responses to the given music samples are rare The issue of scale persists as general hindrance towards breakthroughs in the el while the lack of listener evaluation is especially relevant to the generative modelling problem space where clear objective metrics correlating strongly with qualitative success remain elusive We propose the JS Fake Chorales data set of pieces generated by new learning based algorithm provided in MIDI form We take consecutive outputs from the algorithm and avoid cherry picking in order to validate the potential to further scale this data set on demand We conduct an online experiment for human evaluation designed to be as fair to the listener as possible and nd that respondents were on average only better than random guessing at distinguishing JS Fake Chorales from real chorales composed by JS Bach Furthermore we make an ony mise data collected from experiments available along with the MIDI samples such as the respondents musical experience and how long they took to submit their response for each sample Finally we conduct abl ation studies to demonstrate the effectiveness of using the synthetic pieces for research in polyphonic music modelling and nd that we can improve on state of the art validation set loss for the canonical JS Chorales data set using known algorithm by simply augmenting the training set with the JS Fake Chorales

Triplet is All You Need with Random Mappings for Unsupervised Visual Representation Learning Wen bin Li Xue song Yang Mei hao Kong Lei Wang Jing Huo Yang Gao Jie bo Luo Nanjing University China University of Wollongong Australia University of Rochester USA li wen bin huo jing gao ju edu cn yang xue song kong mei hao smail ju edu cn lei ow edu au luo cs rochester edu Abstract Contrastive self supervised learning SSL has achieved great success in un super vised visual representation learning by maximizing the similarity between two augmented views of the same image positive pairs and simultaneously contrasting other different images negative pairs However this type of methods such as Sim CL Rand Mo Co relies heavily on large number of negative pairs and thus requires either large batches or memory banks In contrast some recent non contrastive SSL methods such as BY OL and Sim Siam attempt to discard negative pairs by introducing asymmetry and show remarkable performance Unfortunately to avoid collapsed solutions caused by not using negative pairs these methods require so phi stica ted asymmetry designs In this paper we argue that negative pairs are still necessary but one is ufc ent triplet is all you need simple triplet based loss can achieve surprisingly good performance without requiring large batches or asymmetry Moreover we observe that unsupervised visual representation learning can gain sign cant ly from randomness Based on this observation we propose simple plug in RandOm MApping ROMA strategy by randomly mapping samples into other spaces and enforcing these randomly projected samples to satisfy the same correlation requirement The proposed ROMA strategy not only achieves the state of the art performance in conjunction with the triplet based loss but also can further effectively boost other SSL methods

Thermally re configurable metal ens Anna Arch etti Ren Jie Lin Nathan al Rest ori Fate meh Kian Ted soul os and Giulia Tag li abu Laboratory of Nano science for Energy Technologies NET STI cole Polytechnique drale de Lausanne Lausanne Switzerland Enlightening Brain Mechanisms Neuroscience Department of Biomedical Sciences University of Padua Padova Italy equal contribution corresponding author giulia tag li abu ep fl ch Abstract Thanks to the compact design and multi functional light manipulation capabilities re configurable meta lenses which consist of arrays of sub wavelength meta atoms offer unique opportunities for advanced optical systems from microscopy to augmented reality platforms Although poorly explored in the context of re configurable metal ens thermo optical effects in resonant silicon nano resonators have recently emerged as viable strategy to realize unable meta atoms In this work we report the proof of concept design of an ultra thin nm thick and thermo optically re configurable silicon metal ens operating at fixed visible wavelength nm Importantly we demonstrate continuous linear modulation of the focal length up to from at to at Operating under right circularly polarized light our metal ens exhibits an average conversion efficiency of close to mechanically modulated devices and has diffraction limited performance Overall we envision that combined with machine learning algorithms for further optimization of the meta atoms thermally re configurable meta lenses with improved performance will be possible Also the generality of this approach could offer inspiration for the realization of active meta surfaces with other emerging material within field of thermo nano photo nics
